Afflicted Irnakurse.name: Irnakurse afligido
Afflicted Irnakurse.publicNotes:
Los irnakurse son elfos de la superficie a quienes los drows han sometido a prácticas de deformación de la carne particularmente crueles y humillantes, ya que los drows se deleitan especialmente con el tormento de sus parientes que habitan en la superficie. El proceso de creación de un irnakurse implica convertir a un desafortunado elfo en una masa deformada de extremidades fuera de lugar, carne suelta y protuberancias óseas; partes que deberían ser internas a menudo se dejan a la vista del mundo. Los Irnakurse están sujetos a un condicionamiento mental que les hace odiar a susformas anteriores, y estas criaturas prefieren atacar a los elfos de la superficie sobre todos los demás objetivos.

Horribles abominaciones remodeladas por vil magia alquímica, las dos deformaciones de carne presentadas aquí fueron creadas por drow, quienes transforman a los elfos o xulgaths capturados en monstruosidades retorcidas que luego pueden ser liberadas para causar estragos y terror.

action->Fearful Curse.name: Maldición aterradora
action->Fearful Curse.description: El irnakurse está permanentemente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 2} , lo que reduce en 1 su nivel efectivo.

action->Mind Lash.name: Latigazo mental
action->Mind Lash.description:
Una criatura no malvada golpeada por el tentáculo de un irnakurse se ve abrumada con imágenes corruptas de una vida arruinada y debe tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:28] o ser @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Aturdido 2} (o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Aturdido 4} en un fallo crítico).

Después de intentar esta salvación, una criatura es temporalmente inmune a Mind Lash durante 24 horas.

action->Rend.name: Rend
action->Rend.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]

Tentáculo

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

action->Soul Scream.name: Grito del alma
action->Soul Scream.description:
Frecuencia una vez al día

Efecto El irnakurse desata un grito alienígena de horror y dolor de pesadilla. Todas las criaturas no malvadas dentro de un @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] deben intentar una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:28]. El irnakurse puede sostener el grito del alma hasta por 6 rondas; cada vez que lo hace, repite el efecto.

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada,y es temporalmente inmune a Soul Scream durante 24 horas.

Éxito La criatura es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 1} durante 1 ronda.

Fallo La criatura está estupefacta 1. Otras salvaciones fallidas contra Soul Scream aumentan el valor de condición en 1, hasta un máximo de estupefacto 4. Cada vez que el personaje descansa toda la noche, la condición de estupefacción obtenida con Soul Scream disminuye en 1

Fallo crítico Como fallo, excepto que el valor estupefacto aumenta en 2 en lugar de 1.

action->Storm of Tentacles.name: Tormenta de tentáculos
action->Storm of Tentacles.description: El irnakurse realiza hasta cuatro golpes de tentáculo, cada uno contra un objetivo diferente. Estos ataques cuentan para la penalización de ataques múltiples del irnakurse, pero la penalización de ataques múltiples no aumenta hasta que realiza todos sus ataques.

Azvalvigander.name: azvalvigander
Azvalvigander.publicNotes:
Los cebúes sirven como mensajeros y espías del infierno. Su capacidad para compartir lo que han visto con otras criaturas los hace especialmente útiles, no sólo para otros demonios, sino también para los prestidigitadores mortales. Algunos señores infernales los desatan en enormes y horribles enjambres sobre tierras desprevenidas para degradar tanto la carne como la tierra mientras recopilan secretos que las huestes infernales podrían utilizar más adelante. Los cebúes aprovechan cualquier oportunidad para manipular a los mortales de voluntad débil o fácilmente tentados para que sirvan sus caprichos.Aunque son arrogantes y engañosos, los cebúes carecen de la astucia y la confianza de la mayoría de los demonios y, por lo tanto, sus planes a menudo se centran en satisfacer ambiciones egoístas o autodestructivas. Los cebúes se forman a partir de las almas de mortales infantiles y cobardes, remodelados por el archidemonio Baalzebul en los inmundos y helados páramos de la séptima capa del infierno, Cocytus.

Cada tipo de demonio juega un papel particular en las burocracias y jerarquías del infierno, aunque algunos tienen funciones mucho más especializadas.funciones que otras.
Azvalvigander.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones vs. magia

spell->Dimension Door.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Puerta de dimensión
spell->Dimension Door.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

spell->Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]
Invisibilidad (a voluntad) (solo para uno mismo)
spell->Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

spell->Infernal Pact.name: Infernal Pact
spell->Infernal Pact.description:
You make an appeal to a powerful devil, asking it to bind some of its subordinates to your service. If you succeed, the devil sends you its choice of one devil whose level is no more than double infernal pact's rank, two devils whose levels are each at least 2 less than double the spell rank, or three devils whose levels are each at least 3 less than double the spell rank.

Critical Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #weeks]]{1d4 weeks}.

Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}.

Failure Your request is denied.

Critical Failure Not only is your request denied, but the powerful devil sends word of its displeasure to your master.
spell->Infernal Pact.primarycheck: Religion (expert; you must be a devil)

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

Heightened (4th) Level 3

Heightened (5th) Level 5

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15

action->Infernal Eye.name: Ojo Infernal
action->Infernal Eye.description:
El cebú registra todo lo que ve y, aunque no recuerda todas las observaciones, puede pasárselas a otra criatura.

El cebú reproduce 10 minutos de eventos presenciados a una criatura conmovida y dispuesta, que recibe los recuerdos en un destello de información. Al permanecer en contacto, el cebú puede realizar actividades adicionales de 3 acciones para reproducir más información.

Después de transmitir sus visiones a otro, el cebú nunca puederecordar esos acontecimientos nuevamente.

Barcumbuk.name: Barcumbuk
Barcumbuk.publicNotes:
Las Erinias exigen venganza y justicia sangrienta por los crímenes de una criatura, torturando y castigando a sus víctimas de manera irónica antes de permitirles escapar de la muerte. Si bien un erinys aparece como un ángel caído y los primeros erinyes compartían ese origen, ahora los erinyes se originan de innumerables maneras, algunas promovidas a partir de demonios menores y otras formadas a partir de lémures forjados a partir de las almas de torturadores y perseguidores. El origen de los erinyes está entrelazado con Eiseth, ella misma un ángel caído yUno de los semidioses más poderosos del infierno. Todas las primeras erinyes fueron consideradas hijas metafóricas de Eiseth, pero las erinyes formadas desde entonces ya no se limitan a un solo género.

Maestros de la corrupción y arquitectos de la conquista, los demonios buscan tentar a la vida mortal para que se una a su búsqueda de todas las cosas profanas y difundir la tiranía por todos los mundos. Las tentaciones que ofrecen a los mortales van desde grandes poderes otorgados por la firma de uncontrato infernal para favores retorcidos tras una promesa susurrada a un patrón diabólico, o cualquier número de intercambios aún más sutiles. Aquellos que sucumben a estas tentaciones se encuentran condenados a una vida futura de tormento sin fin en los pozos del infierno, donde la única esperanza de escapar reside en la posibilidad de ser promovidos a convertirse en un demonio en las filas infernales. Cada diablo tiene un papel específico que desempeñar en el mantenimiento de la implacable máquina burocrática que es el Infierno, desde soldados y eruditos hastainquisidores, abogados, jueces y verdugos. Los humildes lémures y diablillos realizan trabajos subordinados a demonios más poderosos y especializados, como los demonios contratados y los erinyes, mientras que los mayores demonios del abismo comandan ejércitos infernales enteros.
Barcumbuk.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones vs. magia

spell->True Seeing (Constant).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]

spell->True Seeing (Constant).description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

spell->Divine Wrath.name: Divine Wrath
spell->Divine Wrath.description:
You channel the fury of divinity against your foes. You deal 4d10 spirit damage to enemies in the area, depending on their Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}; while it's sickened, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

spell->Retributive Pain.name: Retributive Pain
spell->Retributive Pain.description:
Trigger A creature in range damages you.

You vengefully reflect your pain upon your tormentor. The target takes mental damage equal to half the amount it dealt to you when it triggered the spell.

spell->Fear (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]
Miedo (a voluntad)
spell->Fear (At Will).description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

spell->Illusory Disguise (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]
Disfraz ilusorio (a voluntad)
spell->Illusory Disguise (At Will).description:
You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{Impersonate} use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

Heightened (2nd) The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (3rd) You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{Spell Effect: Illusory Disguise}

spell->Illusory Object.name: Illusory Object
spell->Illusory Object.description:
You create an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.

Any creature that touches the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

Heightened (2nd) Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory trait. The duration increases to 1 hour.

Heightened (5th) As the 2nd-rank version, but the duration is unlimited.

spell->Infernal Pact.name: Infernal Pact
spell->Infernal Pact.description:
You make an appeal to a powerful devil, asking it to bind some of its subordinates to your service. If you succeed, the devil sends you its choice of one devil whose level is no more than double infernal pact's rank, two devils whose levels are each at least 2 less than double the spell rank, or three devils whose levels are each at least 3 less than double the spell rank.

Critical Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #weeks]]{1d4 weeks}.

Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}.

Failure Your request is denied.

Critical Failure Not only is your request denied, but the powerful devil sends word of its displeasure to your master.
spell->Infernal Pact.primarycheck: Religion (expert; you must be a devil)

weapon->Light Hammer.name: Light Hammer
weapon->Light Hammer.description: This smaller version of the warhammer has a wooden or metal shaft ending in a metal head. Unlike its heavier cousin, it is light enough to throw.

weapon->Warhammer.name: Warhammer
weapon->Warhammer.description: This weapon has a wooden shaft ending in a large, heavy metal head. The head of the hammer might be single-sided or double-sided, but it's always capable of delivering powerful bludgeoning blows.

armor->Breastplate.name: Breastplate
armor->Breastplate.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.r0ifJfoz8aqf0mwk]

Aunque se la conoce como coraza, este tipo de armadura consta de varias piezas de armadura de placa o media placa que protegen el torso, el pecho, el cuello y, a veces, las caderas y la parte inferior de las piernas. Otorga estratégicamente parte de la protección de la placa al tiempo que permite una mayor flexibilidad y velocidad.

equipment->100 feet of Erinys-Hair Rope.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]
100 pies de cuerda Erinys-Hair
equipment->100 feet of Erinys-Hair Rope.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]

100 pies de cuerda.

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepatía 100 pies

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Flames of Fury.name: Llamas de furia
action->Flames of Fury.description: Cualquier arma que empuña un erinys obtiene los efectos de una runa @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} mientras la empuña.

action->Furious Fusillade.name: Fusilamiento furioso
action->Furious Fusillade.description: Los erinys flotan en su lugar si están volando y disparan una flecha a cualquier número de criaturas en un @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Cada ataque se lanza por separado. Esto cuenta como un ataque a efectos de la penalización por ataque múltiple de Erinys.

action->Rope Snare.name: Trampa de cuerda
action->Rope Snare.description:
Un erinys lleva un rollo de cuerda tejido con su cabello (use las estadísticas para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]{Rope}) que se anima en sus manos.

Cuando una criatura es golpeada por la cuerda del erinys, un segmento de la cuerda se suelta y se enrolla alrededor de la criatura, imponiendo una penalización de circunstancia de 10 pies a la Velocidad. La pieza que se arranca mide 10 pies de largo para una criatura Mediana o más pequeña, y duplica su longitud para cada tamaño mayor que Mediano.

Cuando una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} el efecto (CD 26), el segmento de cuerda desprendido se marchita y se convierte en un lodo negro inútil.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.o0zqsH5kYopRanav]{Effect: Rope Snare}

Befuddling Gas Trap.name: Trampa de gas desconcertante
Befuddling Gas Trap.description: Siete boquillas escondidas dentro de agujeros en el techo de 15 pies de altura liberan un gas venenoso.
Befuddling Gas Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Hidden Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (maestro) para desactivar el mecanismo oculto en la pared norte, succionando inmediatamente el gas de la habitación, o @Check[type:thievery|dc:29|name:Plug One Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (experto) para tapar adecuadamente una de las siete boquillas. Cuando las siete boquillas están tapadas o destruidas, la trampa se desactiva.
Befuddling Gas Trap.reset: Después de una hora, la trampa se desactiva; el gas se dispersa lentamente y las puertas se pueden volver a abrir. Después de 24 horas, el gas se acumula y la trampa puede activarse nuevamente.
Befuddling Gas Trap.routine:
(1 acción) El gas se intensifica. Cada criatura en la habitación debe hacer un @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30].

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada y se vuelve temporalmente inmune al gas durante 1 hora, aunque si la criatura ya ha quedado estupefacta por la trampa, esa condición permanece por su duración normal.

Éxito La criatura no se ve afectada.

Fallo La criatura se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 1} durante 24 horas. Si el objetivo ya está estupefacto, el valor de condición aumenta en 1 (hasta un máximo de estupefacto 4) y el objetivo sufre @Damage[8d6[mental]] de daño.

Efecto crítico Como fracaso, excepto que el objetivo sufre el doble de daño mental.
Befuddling Gas Trap.stealth: +21 (experto) o @Check[type:perception|dc:31|traits:action:seek] (experto) para notar el mecanismo de anulación oculto en la pared norte

action->Gas Release.name: Liberación de gas
action->Gas Release.description:
Activador Ambas puertas secretas están cerradas y al menos una criatura está en la habitación

Efecto El gas llena la cámara. Las criaturas dentro de la cámara deben tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] o convertirse en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 1} ( @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 2} en un fallo crítico). La trampa luego tira iniciativa.

Belcorra Haruvex.name: Belcorra Haruvex
Belcorra Haruvex.privateNotes:
During their trek through the lowest levels of the Abomination Vaults, the heroes likely face Belcorra several times before they finally acquire the fulcrum lenses they need to defeat her for good. She learns about them from her wisp allies and you can thereafter use her whenever her appearance might cause the most tension. She should attack at least once on each dungeon level, as often as every couple of days. You shouldn't have Belcorra fight alongside other creatures until the adventure's finale-she's tough enough on her own!

Each time Belcorra attacks, she learns more about how the heroes fight and adapts her tactics and her preparations. She might cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tgIhRUFtgDSELpJE]{Spell Immunity} to protect herself from the heroes' most effective spells, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen} to keep them in sight, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} to counter their magical defenses. She mocks the heroes for their failures and rages at their successes-remember, she has been aware of them since her test firing of Gauntlight's beam in "Ruins of Gauntlight."

First Attack As soon as Belcorra realizes the heroes' presence, she seeks them out, traveling through the Gauntlight footprint (areas A37 and B28). She casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity} at a distance and retreats, moving through walls if necessary so the heroes can't follow.

Second Attack Belcorra wants the heroes to fear her, so she approaches them more closely the second time and uses single-target spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Never Mind} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} while demanding the heroes flee her Abomination Vaults. With her message delivered, she retreats after only a few rounds.

Later Attacks Once the heroes have recovered a fulcrum lens or the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JwHNSaiwwqF7VCC5]{Fulcrum Lattice}, Belcorra considers the heroes an actual threat, but her anger overrides her caution. She attacks with her full might, using her Corrupting Gaze and ghostly hand along with her spells. If she defeats a hero, she retreats, confident that they'll leave her alone.

Leveraging Agents Belcorra has several living allies within the Abomination Vaults, including the urdefhan cult and the Children of Belcorra. She might send these groups after the heroes, insisting they let the heroes know they're acting on Belcorra's orders. Fortunately, neither group can muster large numbers, so the heroes should be able to manage an attack from them.

Killing Allies Belcorra learns if the heroes make alliances, such as with nearby calignis or drow. She knows better than to face powerful, entrenched leaders like Galudu or Quara, but she might murder a few guards or direct monsters where they can most damage the heroes' allies. It's important to Belcorra that she leave some evidence (usually a single, injured survivor) to let the heroes know she had orchestrated the attack.

In the Footprint Belcorra is most effective fighting the heroes who enter the Gauntlight footprint (areas A37 and B28) due to her Haunted Lighthouse ability.

The Final Attack If the heroes defeat Belcorra shortly before they reach the Empty Vault, she uses the power of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.CTiLugp5ptSItEqN]{Ebon Fulcrum Lens} to hasten her rejuvenation so she can face them in her sanctum. Belcorra doesn't ever surrender or flee in the Empty Vault. The heroes could possibly face her there without yet having the ability to permanently defeat her. In this case, they'll need to retreat to collect the fulcrum lenses and return to face her again. Once the heroes can focus Nhimbaloth's gaze upon Belcorra, they can defeat the sorcerer for good.
Belcorra Haruvex.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones vs. magia

spellcastingEntry->Sorcerer Bloodline Sp.name: Hechizos de línea de sangre de hechicero

spell->Legend Lore.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hp6Q64dl7xbdn4gQ]
Historia de la leyenda
spell->Legend Lore.cost: rare incense worth a total value of 300 gp
spell->Legend Lore.description:
You attempt to learn useful legends about a particular subject, which must be an important person, place, or thing. If the subject is present, increase the degree of success of your primary skill check by one step. If you have only vague information about the subject before attempting the ritual, decrease the degree of success of your primary skill check by one step. These modifiers cancel each other out if you have a subject present with little to no baseline information.

Critical Success You recite legends, tales, and lore about the subject over the course of an hour after the ritual ends. The information is mostly coherent, emphasizing more accurate or useful legends over those exaggerated over time.

Success You recite mysterious legends, tales, and lore about the subject over the course of an hour after the ritual ends. These provide useful information for further inquiry but are generally incomplete or enigmatic. As is the nature of legends, you are likely to learn multiple contradictory versions.

Failure You fail to learn any useful legends.

Critical Failure Your mind becomes lost in the past. You can't sense or respond to anything in the present for 1 week except to perform necessities like breathing and sleeping. When you return, however, you can retrain one of your skills into a Lore based on the knowledge of the past you were uncontrollably viewing, as if you had spent 1 week retraining.

spell->Teleportation Circle.name: Teleportation Circle
spell->Teleportation Circle.cost: rare incense, precious metals, and purified chalk worth 500 gp;
spell->Teleportation Circle.description:
You create a 10-foot-diameter circle on the ground, which acts as a portal to a destination determined at the time of the ritual. You designate the destination of the teleportation as part of the ritual. This destination can't be changed. The destination must be a location within 1,000 miles and be on the same plane as the teleportation circle. You must be able to identify the location precisely both by its position relative to the location where you create the teleportation circle and by the destination's appearance (or other identifying features). The destination must also be a 10-foot-diameter circle that doesn't overlap with any solid structures, but it can be a place that is harmful or dangerous.

A secondary caster attempting a Survival check for this ritual can be located at the exact site of the destination, instead of with you at the point of origin. If the secondary succeeds at their check at the destination and you roll a success, the ritual is a critical success instead.

While the circle is active, any creature that moves to be fully within the circle is instantly teleported to the destination. A creature that is unwilling to be teleported can attempt a Will save to resist the effect. If it remains in the circle, the creature must attempt this save again at the end of each of its turns.

The teleportation circle normally goes only in one direction, though you can double the Cost to make the teleportation work in both directions.

Critical Success You create the teleportation circle, and it's extremely precise, regardless of the distance traveled. Travelers arrive exactly at the designated point.

Success As a critical success, but the destination of the teleportation circle is slightly inaccurate, and is off target by roughly 1 percent of the distance traveled, to a maximum of 10 miles off target.

Failure The teleportation circle doesn't function.

Critical Failure The teleportation circle is wildly inaccurate. It leads to a random destination roughly the same distance from the origin point, and the chances of some other unusual mishap are much greater.

Heightened (9th) The cost increases to 2,000 gp, the duration increases to 1 month, and the destination can be anywhere on the same planet.

Heightened (10th) The cost increases to 10,000 gp, the duration is unlimited, and the destination can be anywhere on the same planet.

spell->Feeblemind.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]
Débil
spell->Feeblemind.description:
You drastically reduce the target's mental faculties. The target must attempt a Will save. The effects of this curse can be removed only through remove curse or another effect that targets curses.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} with an unlimited duration.

Critical Failure The target's intellect is permanently reduced below that of an animal, and it treats its Charisma, Intelligence, and Wisdom modifiers as -5. It loses all class abilities that require mental faculties, including all spellcasting. If the target is a PC, they become an NPC under the GM's control.

spell->Phantasmal Calamity.name: Phantasmal Calamity
spell->Phantasmal Calamity.description:
A vision of apocalyptic destruction fills the mind of each creature in the area. The vision deals 11d6 mental damage (basic Will save). On a critical failure, the creature must also succeed at a Reflex save or believe it's trapped (stuck in a fissure, adrift at sea, or some other fate in keeping with its vision). If it fails the second save, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new Will save at the end of each of its turns, and on a success, it disbelieves the illusion and recovers from the Stunned condition.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Planar Binding.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]
Encuadernación plana
spell->Planar Binding.cost: ingredientes del diagrama de protección por un valor total de 2 po × el rango del hechizo × el nivel del objetivo
spell->Planar Binding.description:
You call forth an extraplanar creature of a level no greater than double that of the planar binding ritual's level and attempt to bargain with it. The secondary caster attempting the Crafting check creates a warding diagram to prevent the extraplanar creature from attacking or leaving during the bargain; if that caster fails or critically fails, then instead of the usual effects of a failure or critical failure of the secondary skill check, the extraplanar creature can attack or leave instead of negotiate. You can also leave out this step, removing the need for a Crafting check, with the same result (if you're summoning a good extraplanar creature you trust, for example). The creature can also attack or leave if you use any hostile action against it or if the warding diagram breaks. Once the diagram is complete, you and the secondary casters each take your places at specific points at the diagram's edge where power concentrates.

You conjure the extraplanar creature within your wards and negotiate a deal with it, generally to perform a task for you in exchange for payment. A creature that doesn't wish to negotiate at all can attempt a Will save to stay on its home plane. Most good and neutral extraplanar creatures feel that they have something better to do than cater to the whims of mortals and require a significant gift, especially if your task poses significant risks. Evil extraplanar creatures are more likely to accept a bargain for a lower cost as long as it allows them to wreak havoc on the Material Plane or inflict evil upon the world along the way. Monetary prices usually range from the cost of a consumable item of the creature's level for a short and simple task to a permanent magic item of the creature's level or more to persuade the creature to fight alongside you. However, some extraplanar creatures may want payments other than money, such as permission to cast a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q690d3mw3TUrKX7E]{Geas} on you to fulfill an unspecified later favor or obtain ownership of your soul via an infernal contract. If you can't come to an agreement in a reasonable length of time after you've made your case, the extraplanar creature can return from whence it came at any time.

Critical Success You call the extraplanar creature and bind it in the wards for up to a full day before it returns home, potentially allowing you to negotiate a better deal by threatening to leave it in the wards for the full day.

Success You call the extraplanar creature.

Failure You fail to call the extraplanar creature.

Critical Failure You call something dark and horrible, unbound by your wards, and it immediately attempts to destroy you.
spell->Planar Binding.secondarycheck: Elaboración; Diplomacia o intimidación; Arcanos u Ocultismo (lo que no se use para la verificación principal)

spell->True Seeing.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]
Verdadera visión
spell->True Seeing.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

spell->Black Tentacles.name: Black Tentacles
spell->Black Tentacles.description:
Area 20-foot burst adjacent to a flat surface

Oily black tentacles rise up and attempt to capture creatures in the area. Make spell attack rolls against the Fortitude DC of each creature in the area. Any creature you succeed against is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage. Whenever a creature ends its turn in the area, the tentacles attempt to grab that creature if they haven't already, and they deal @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage to any creature already Grabbed.

The tentacles' Escape DC is equal to your spell DC. A creature can attack a tentacle in an attempt to release its grip. Its AC is equal to your spell DC, and it is destroyed if it takes 12 or more damage. Even if destroyed, additional tentacles continue to grow in the area until the duration ends. You can Dismiss the spell.

spell->Crushing Despair.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]
Desesperación aplastante
spell->Crushing Despair.description:
You inflict despair on creatures in the area. The effects for each creature are determined by its Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the creature can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of its turn; on a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that turn as it sobs uncontrollably.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Heightened (7th) The area increases to a 60-foot cone.

spell->Illusory Scene.name: Illusory Scene
spell->Illusory Scene.description:
You form an imaginary scene that includes up to 10 discrete creatures or objects of various sizes, all of which must be within the spell's area. These elements generate appropriate sounds and smells, and they feel right to the touch. Elements of an illusory scene are incapable of speech. Unlike with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{Illusory Creature} spell, creatures in your scene lack combat abilities and statistics. Your scene doesn't include changes to the environment around it, though you can place your scene within the illusory environment of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spell.

When you create the scene, you can choose to have it be static or follow a program. Though a static scene is stationary, it includes basic natural movement. For example, wind blowing on an illusory piece of paper would rustle it. A program can be up to 1 minute long and repeats when finished. For instance, you could create a scene of two orcs fighting each other, and the fight would go the same way for each repetition. If you create a loop, the two fighters end up in the same place at the start of the scene and at the end of it, but you can smooth the program so it's hard to tell when the loop ends and begins. Anyone observing the scene for more than a few minutes almost always notices it looping. You're unable to alter the program after you create the illusion.

Any creature that touches any part of the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion. If they interact with a portion of the illusion, they disbelieve only that portion. They disbelieve the entire scene only on a critical success.

Heightened (6th) Creatures or objects in your scene can speak. You must speak the specific lines for each actor when creating your program. The spell disguises your voice for each actor.

Heightened (8th) As the 6th-rank version, and the duration is unlimited.

spell->Tongues.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]
lenguas
spell->Tongues.description:
The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours.

spell->Confusion.name: Confusion
spell->Confusion.description:
You befuddle your target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. You can Dismiss the spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target babbles incoherently and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

Critical Failure The target is Confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Globe of Invulnerability.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.JOdOpbPDl7nqvJUm]
Globo de invulnerabilidad
spell->Globe of Invulnerability.description:
You create an immobile globe around yourself that attempts to counteract any spell from outside the globe whose area or targets enter into the globe, as if the globe were a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell 1 rank lower than its actual spell rank.

If the counteract attempt succeeds, it prevents only the portion of the spell that would have entered the globe (so if the spell also has targets outside the globe, or part of its area is beyond the globe, those targets or that area is affected normally).

You must form the sphere in an unbroken open space, so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost (though creatures can enter the globe after the spell is cast).

spell->Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
spell->Phantasmal Killer.description:
You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the target. Only the spell's target can see the killer, though you can see the vague shape of the illusion as it races forth to attack. The effect of the killer is based on the outcome of the target's Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes 4d6 mental damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target takes 8d6 mental damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is so afraid it might die. It must attempt a Fortitude save; if the target fails, it dies. On a successful Fortitude save, the target takes 12d6 mental damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} until the end of its next turn, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}. This effect has the incapacitation trait.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6 on a failure and by 3d6 on a critical failure.

spell->Spell Immunity.name: Spell Immunity
spell->Spell Immunity.description: You ward a creature against the effects of a single spell. Choose a spell and name it aloud as part of the verbal component. Spell immunity attempts to counteract that spell whenever spell immunity's target is the target of the named spell or in that spell's area. Successfully counteracting a spell that targets an area or multiple targets with spell immunity negates the effects only for the target affected by spell immunity.

spell->Aberrant Whispers.name: Aberrant Whispers
spell->Aberrant Whispers.description:
You utter phrases in an unknown tongue, assaulting the minds of those nearby. Each target must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of its save, each target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

You can increase the number of actions it takes to Cast the Spell (to a maximum of 3 actions total). For each additional action, increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet, to a maximum of 10 extra feet for 3 actions.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}.

Heightened (+3) The initial radius increases by 5 feet.

spell->Mind Reading.name: Mind Reading
spell->Mind Reading.description:
With a cursory mental touch, you attempt to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your mind reading for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target perceives vague surface thoughts from you when you Cast the Spell.

Success You find out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Failure You perceive vague surface thoughts from the target when you Cast the Spell, and you find out whether its Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Critical Failure As failure, and for the duration of the spell, you can Sustain the Spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

spell->Nondetection.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]
No detectado
spell->Nondetection.description: You erect protective wards that make the target difficult to detect via magic. Nondetection attempts to counteract all detection, revelation, and scrying divinations made against the target or the target's gear throughout the duration, counting cantrips as 1st-rank spells for this purpose. Successfully counteracting a divination that targets an area or multiple targets negates the effects only for nondetection's target.

spell->Paralyze.name: Paralyze
spell->Paralyze.description:
You block the target's motor impulses before they can leave its mind, threatening to freeze the target in place. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is Paralyzed for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Vampiric Touch.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]
Toque vampírico
spell->Vampiric Touch.description:
Your touch leeches the lifeblood out of a target to empower yourself. You deal 6d6 void damage to the target. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to half the void damage the target takes (after applying resistances and the like). You lose any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Death Knell.name: Death Knell
spell->Death Knell.description:
You snuff the life out of a creature on the brink of death. The target must attempt a Will save. If this kills it, you gain 10 temporary HP and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} value increases by 1.

Failure The target dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.98XT2QUk6wvXIqf7]{Spell Effect: Death Knell}

spell->Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
spell->Dispel Magic.description: You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.
spell->Dispel Magic.target: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item

spell->See Invisibility.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]
Ver Invisibilidad
spell->See Invisibility.description:
You can see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures and objects. They appear to you as translucent shapes, and they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to you.

Heightened (5th) The spell has a duration of 8 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.T5bk6UH7yuYog1Fp]{Spell Effect: See the Unseen}

spell->Telekinetic Maneuver.name: Telekinetic Maneuver
spell->Telekinetic Maneuver.description: With a rush of telekinetic power, you move a foe or something they carry. You can attempt to Disarm, Shove, or Trip the target using a spell attack roll instead of an Athletics check.

spell->Touch of Idiocy.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CQb8HtQ1BPeZmu9h]
Toque de idiotez
spell->Touch of Idiocy.description:
You dull the target's mind; the target must attempt a Will save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}.

spell->Daze.name: Daze
spell->Daze.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Ghost Sound.name: Ghost Sound
spell->Ghost Sound.description:
You create an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square you designate within range. You can't create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).

Heightened (3rd) The range increases to 60 feet.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 120 feet.

spell->Mage Hand.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mano de mago
spell->Mage Hand.description:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
spell->Mage Hand.target: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

spell->Mindlink.name: Mindlink
spell->Mindlink.description: You link your mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]
Rayo de debilitamiento
spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

spell->Read Aura.name: Read Aura
spell->Read Aura.description:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

spell->Spider Sting.name: Spider Sting
spell->Spider Sting.description:
You magically duplicate a spider's venomous sting. You deal 1d4 piercing damage to the touched creature and afflict it with spider venom. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage.

Failure The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 1.

Critical Failure The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 2.

Spider Venom (poison)

Level 1

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 1d4 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 1d4 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

spell->Telekinetic Projectile.name: Telekinetic Projectile
spell->Telekinetic Projectile.description:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack roll against the target. If you hit, you deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage-as appropriate for the object you hurled-equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.

Critical Success You deal double damage.

Success You deal full damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Tentacular Limbs.name: Tentacular Limbs
spell->Tentacular Limbs.description:
Your arms turn into long, pliable tentacles, increasing your reach when you're delivering touch range spells and making unarmed Strikes with your arms (such as fist and claw Strikes) to 10 feet. This doesn't change the reach of your melee weapon attacks. During the duration, whenever you Cast a Spell, you can add an additional action to that spell's casting to temporarily extend your reach to 20 feet to deliver that spell.

Heightened (+2) When you add an additional action to a spell to temporarily extend your reach, your reach increases by an additional 10 feet to deliver that spell.

spell->True Strike.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]
Golpe verdadero
spell->True Strike.description:
A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.fpGDAz2v5PG0zUSl]{Spell Effect: Sure Strike}

action->Magic Sense.name: Sentido mágico
action->Magic Sense.description: Belcorra puede sentir la presencia de auras mágicas como si siempre estuviera usando un hechizo de primer rango @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic}. Cuando @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks}, obtiene los beneficios de un hechizo de tercer rango para detectar magia en las cosas que ve.

action->Site Bound.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]
Vinculado al sitio
action->Site Bound.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

Los tres niveles más bajos de las Bóvedas de Abominación

Un fantasma típico puede alejarse sólo una corta distancia del lugar donde fue asesinado o del lugar que frecuenta. Un límite típico es de 120 pies. En cambio, algunos fantasmas están vinculados a una habitación, edificio, elemento o criatura que era especial para ellos en lugar de una ubicación.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Rejuvenation.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]
Rejuvenecimiento
action->Rejuvenation.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Cuando Belcorra es destruida, se vuelve a formar en [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days} dentro de la Bóveda Vacía (aunque puede reducir ese tiempo fortaleciéndose con destellos de la esencia de Nhimbaloth usando el @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.CTiLugp5ptSItEqN]{Ebon Fulcrum Lens}).

Belcorra sólo puede ser destruida permanentemente si se venga completamente de Absalom o si Nhimbaloth devora su alma.

action->Blood Magic.name: Magia de sangre
action->Blood Magic.description:
Cada vez que Belcorra lanza un hechizo de linaje de hechicero o un hechizo otorgado de linaje aberrante, puede otorgarse a sí misma o al objetivo del hechizo una bonificación de estado de +2 a las tiradas de salvación de Voluntad durante 1 asalto.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4GAJHkurmZ1ttKDv]{Effect: Blood Magic}

action->Corrupting Gaze.name: Mirada corruptora
action->Corrupting Gaze.description:
Belcorra mira fijamente a una criatura que puede ver a menos de 30 pies. El objetivo sufre @Damage[9d6[mental]] daño ( @Check[type:will|dc:33|basic:true] salvación).

Una criatura que falla su salvación también es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 1} durante 1 minuto.

action->Haunted Lighthouse.name: Faro embrujado
action->Haunted Lighthouse.description:
Frecuencia una vez cada 10 minutos

Efecto Belcorra extiende su presencia a lo largo de los tres niveles más bajos de Gauntlight hasta el final de su siguiente turno. Puede ver con los beneficios de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.9qV49KjZujZnSp6w]{All-Around Vision} y ​​puede realizar ataques con manos fantasmales o usar habilidades especiales que se originan en cualquier superficie de esta área.

action->Quickened Casting.name: Fundición acelerada
action->Quickened Casting.description:
Frecuencia una vez al día

Efecto Si la siguiente acción de Belcorra es lanzar un hechizo de hechicero de 4º rango o inferior, reduce el número de acciones para lanzarlo en 1 (mínimo 1 acción).

Beluthus.name: Beluto
Beluthus.publicNotes: Cuando los demonios y los poderosos lanzadores de hechizos malvados se pierden más allá de los confines más lejanos del multiverso, a veces regresan como horribles no-muertos llamados devoradores que consumen las almas de los vivos para alimentar sus maquinaciones arcanas. Sus cuerpos están arruinados y reconstruidos, vacíos y retorcidos, incluso cuando sus mentes experimentan una transformación espiritual. Obtienen la capacidad de unir otras almas a la suya y drenar su esencia para obtener poder mágico, pero nunca pueden saciarse en su búsqueda.Masas hirvientes de formas fantasmales distorsionadas surgen dentro de sus cajas torácicas huecas: manifestaciones de las almas consumidas más recientemente de los devoradores.
Beluthus.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones vs. magia

spell->Feeblemind.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]
Débil
spell->Feeblemind.description:
You drastically reduce the target's mental faculties. The target must attempt a Will save. The effects of this curse can be removed only through remove curse or another effect that targets curses.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} with an unlimited duration.

Critical Failure The target's intellect is permanently reduced below that of an animal, and it treats its Charisma, Intelligence, and Wisdom modifiers as -5. It loses all class abilities that require mental faculties, including all spellcasting. If the target is a PC, they become an NPC under the GM's control.

spell->True Seeing.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]
Verdadera visión
spell->True Seeing.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

spell->Confusion.name: Confusion
spell->Confusion.description:
You befuddle your target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. You can Dismiss the spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target babbles incoherently and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

Critical Failure The target is Confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Suggestion.name: Suggestion
spell->Suggestion.description:
Your honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. You suggest a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self-destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and knows you tried to control it.

Success The target is unaffected and thinks you were talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

Failure The target immediately follows your suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

Critical Failure As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Bind Undead.name: Bind Undead
spell->Bind Undead.description:
With a word of power, you seize control of the target. It gains the minion trait. If you or an ally uses any hostile actions against the target, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.rVkUzqS4rpZp9LS3]{Spell Effect: Bind Undead}
spell->Bind Undead.target: 1 mindless undead creature with a level no greater than bind undead's spell rank

spell->Paralyze.name: Paralyze
spell->Paralyze.description:
You block the target's motor impulses before they can leave its mind, threatening to freeze the target in place. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is Paralyzed for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Create Undead.name: Create Undead
spell->Create Undead.description:
You transform the target into an undead creature with a level up to that allowed in Table 7-1. There are many versions of this ritual, each specific to a particular type of undead (one ritual for all zombies, one for skeletons, one for ghouls, and so on), and the rituals that create rare undead are also rare. Some forms of undead, such as liches, form using their own unique methods and can't be created with a version of create undead.

Table 7-1: Creatures Creation Rituals

Creature Level Spell Rank Required Cost
-1 or 0 2 15 gp
1 2 60 gp
2 3 105 gp
3 3 180 gp
4 4 300 gp
5 4 480 gp
6 5 750 gp
7 5 1,080 gp
8 6 1,500 gp
9 6 2,100 gp
10 7 3,000 gp
11 7 4,200 gp
12 8 6,000 gp
13 8 9,000 gp
14 9 13,500 gp
15 9 19,500 gp
16 10 30,000 gp
17 10 45,000 gp

Critical Success The target becomes an undead creature of the appropriate type. If it's at least 4 levels lower than you, you can make it a minion. This gives it the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you command it, and commanding it is a single action that has the auditory and concentrate traits. You can have a maximum of four minions under your control. If it's intelligent and doesn't become a minion, the undead is helpful to you for awakening it, though it's still a horrid and evil creature. If it's unintelligent and doesn't become a minion, you can give it one simple command. It pursues that goal single-mindedly, ignoring any of your subsequent commands.

Success As critical success, except an intelligent undead that doesn't become your minion is only friendly to you, and an unintelligent undead that doesn't become your minion leaves you alone unless you attack it. It marauds the local area rather than following your command.

Failure You fail to create the undead.

Critical Failure You create the undead, but its soul, tortured by your foul necromancy, is full of nothing but hatred for you. It attempts to destroy you.

spell->Death Knell.name: Death Knell
spell->Death Knell.description:
You snuff the life out of a creature on the brink of death. The target must attempt a Will save. If this kills it, you gain 10 temporary HP and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} value increases by 1.

Failure The target dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.98XT2QUk6wvXIqf7]{Spell Effect: Death Knell}

spell->Harm.name: Harm
spell->Harm.description:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (material, verbal, somatic) You disperse void energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
spell->Harm.target: 1 living creature or 1 willing undead creature

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 estado a todas las partidas guardadas contra Magic

action->Spell Deflection.name: Desviación de hechizos
action->Spell Deflection.description:
Un lanzador de conjuros que apunta a un devorador con un hechizo mental, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hVU9msO9yGkxKZ3J]{Divine Wrath} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ht35SDf9PDStJfoC]{Spirit Song} pueden intentar una prueba de contraataque para liberar un alma que el devorador ha atrapado con Devorar alma. Si este intento de contrarrestar tiene éxito, el alma atrapada se libera (aunque la criatura permanece muerta) y el devorador no puede usar ninguna alma.cargas de esa criatura.

Los devoradores son inmunes a estos hechizos.

action->Devour Soul.name: Devorar alma
action->Devour Soul.description:
El devorador toca una criatura a su alcance, causando @Damage[8d6[void]] daño ( @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true] salvación). Si una criatura muere por este ataque, su alma queda atrapada dentro del devorador. Mientras su alma está atrapada, una criatura no puede resucitar excepto mediante magia poderosa como un hechizo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}. Destruir al devorador o contrarrestar con éxito Devorar alma (ver desviación de hechizos) libera el alma. El devorador sólo puede retener un alma a la vez.

Un alma tiene 5 cargas de alma por nivel de la criatura que la origina (consulte la habilidad de hechizos de alma a continuación). El devorador puede gastar estas cargas para lanzar hechizos. Si el alma se libera y la criatura vuelve a la vida, la criatura es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1} por cada 5 cargas de alma gastadas. Si se reduce a 0 cargas de alma, el alma se consume y puede recuperar la vida solo mediante magia poderosa como deseo .

action->Drain Life.name: Drenar la vida
action->Drain Life.description: Cuando el devorador daña a una criatura viviente con su golpe de garra, el devorador gana 10 puntos de vida temporales y la criatura debe tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] o convertirse en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1}. El daño adicional infligido por el devorador aumenta el valor de la condición en 1 en caso de una salvación fallida, hasta un máximo de drenado 4.

action->Soul Spells.name: Hechizos del alma
action->Soul Spells.description: Un devorador lanza hechizos innatos ocultos, pero para hacerlo debe gastar una cantidad de cargas de alma igual al rango del hechizo (similar a lanzar un hechizo usando cargas de un bastón). Puede aumentar cualquier hechizo hasta un máximo de 6º nivel gastando más cargas mientras lanza el hechizo. Cuando se encuentra, un devorador normalmente tiene un alma atrapada con 10 cargas de alma.

Blast Tumbler.name: Vaso explosivo
Blast Tumbler.description: Se coloca una runa de difícil acceso en el tambor de la cerradura. Emite una ráfaga de fuerza cuando se empuja la puerta.
Blast Tumbler.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|name:Disarm the Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (maestro) para desarmar la runa, o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5º nivel; contrarrestar CD 28) para contrarrestar la magia de la runa.
Blast Tumbler.reset: La runa se reinicia 1 minuto después de activarse.

action->Force Blast.name: Explosión de fuerza
action->Force Blast.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura no muerta abre la puerta o falla críticamente en un intento de desarmar o disipar la runa

Efecto Un cono de fuerza de 30 pies sale de la cerradura. Las criaturas dentro del cono deben superar una tirada de salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true] o sufrir @Damage[8d12[force]] de daño. Aquellos que fallan en la salvación son empujados 10 pies, y aquellos que fallan críticamente son empujados 20 pies y son @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Aturdido 2}.

Blood of Belcorra.name: Sangre de Belcorra
Blood of Belcorra.description: Surge una imagen sangrienta de Belcorra, emite una luz que drena el alma y luego inhala sangre de las criaturas vivientes en la habitación.
Blood of Belcorra.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Wipe Away Blood] (entrenado) para limpiar suficiente mancha de sangre para interrumpir las energías nigrománticas del refugio, o @Check[type:religion|dc:20|name:Excorcise Haunt] (entrenado) para exorcizar el refugio
Blood of Belcorra.reset:
Si el refugio queda inhabilitado o destruido por daño, el sangriento fantasma de Belcorra se lanza hacia arriba en espiral, empapando la trampilla que conduce al área A25 antes de drenar hacia arriba a través del ojo de la cerradura, lo que reduce la CD de Robo a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick the Lock} a @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Pick Trap Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock,skill,manipulate].

Al siguiente amanecer, la sangre regresa a esta habitación y el refugio se reinicia. El refugio se destruye permanentemente una vez que Lasda Venkervale es rescatada del área. D9 .
Blood of Belcorra.routine:
(1 acción) La imagen sangrienta abre la boca y parece inhalar, extrayendo sangre del cuerpo de una criatura en su línea de visión dentro de 90 pies del centro del área A11 . La criatura objetivo debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect].

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada.

Éxito La criatura toma @Damage[1d10[bleed]].

Fallo La criatura sufre @Damage[(1d10+6)[bleed]] de daño.

Fallo crítico La criatura recibe @Damage[(2d10+6)[bleed]] daño y es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 2} mientras esté sangrando.

action->Gauntlight Beam.name: Haz de luz guantelete
action->Gauntlight Beam.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura viviente termina su turno en el área A11 de noche

Efecto Una imagen espantosa de Belcorra, aparentemente compuesta de sangre fresca, se eleva desde la mancha de sangre en el suelo y gira en su lugar como un faro. Rayos de fría luz azul brillan en los ojos y la boca abierta de Belcorra, provocando que ampollas y descomposición se extiendan por la carne. Criaturas vivas dentro de un @Template[type:burst|distance:30]desde el centro del área A11 debe intentar una parada @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect].

La guarida tira la iniciativa.

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada.

Éxito La criatura sufre @Damage[1d8[void]] de daño.

Fallo La criatura recibe @Damage[(1d8+6)[void]] daño y es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Deslumbrado} durante 1 ronda.

Fallo crítico La criatura sufre @Damage[(2d8+6)[void]] de daño y es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Cegado} durante 1 asalto y luego deslumbrada durante 1 asalto.

action->Tremorsense 30 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense 30 pies

action->Death Burst.name: Explosión de muerte
action->Death Burst.description:
20 pies. Cuando el sifón de sangre muere, su cuerpo explota en un estallido rojo turbio de sangre seca necrótica en un área de 20 pies.

Las criaturas dentro del alcance deben intentar una salvación @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect].

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada.

Éxito La criatura sufre @Damage[2d6[void]] de daño.

Fracaso Ella criatura sufre @Damage[4d6[void]] de daño.

Fallo crítico La criatura recibe @Damage[6d6[void]] daño y es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 2} durante 1 hora.

action->Blood Drain.name: Drenaje de sangre
action->Blood Drain.description:
Requisitos El sifón de sangre tiene una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizado}

Efecto El sifón de sangre drena la sangre de la criatura que ha agarrado. Esto causa [[/r {4d4}]]{4d4 damage} y ​​el sifón de sangre se vuelve temporalmente húmedo y viscoso a medida que recupera [[/r 8[healing]]]{8 Hit Points} , ganando cualquier exceso como puntos de vida temporales que duran 1 minuto.

Una criatura a la que le drena la sangre el sifón de sangre es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1} hasta que reciba algún tipo de curación.

action->Loose Bones.name: Huesos sueltos
action->Loose Bones.description: Un golpe crítico empuja los huesos sueltos del esqueleto, haciéndolo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 1} . Los golpes críticos adicionales aumentan este valor, hasta @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 4} .

action->Broad Swipe.name: Deslizamiento amplio
action->Broad Swipe.description: El esqueleto realiza dos golpes con su garra contra dos enemigos adyacentes, ambos a su alcance. La penalización por ataque múltiple no aumenta hasta que se resuelvan ambos ataques.

action->Terrifying Charge.name: Carga aterradora
action->Terrifying Charge.description: El esqueleto da zancadas y realiza un golpe de garra con una bonificación de circunstancia de +4 al daño. Si el Golpe impacta, intenta @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} el objetivo.

spell->Speak with Animals (At Will) (Art.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BBvV7qoXGdw09q1C]
Habla con animales (a voluntad) (solo artrópodos)
spell->Speak with Animals (At Will) (Art.description: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

spell->Bane.name: Bane
spell->Bane.description:
You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt.
