Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

spell->Freedom of Movement.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]
Libertad de movimiento
spell->Freedom of Movement.description: You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.

spell->Hydraulic Torrent.name: Hydraulic Torrent
spell->Hydraulic Torrent.description:
A swirling torrent of water manifests along a straight line, battering creatures and unattended objects in its path and possibly pushing them away from you. The torrent deals 8d6 bludgeoning damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a basic Fortitude save; unattended objects automatically fail. Creatures and objects that fail are also knocked back 5 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->See Invisibility (Constant).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]
Ver Invisibilidad (Constante)
spell->See Invisibility (Constant).description:
You can see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures and objects. They appear to you as translucent shapes, and they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to you.

Heightened (5th) The spell has a duration of 8 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.T5bk6UH7yuYog1Fp]{Spell Effect: See the Unseen}

spell->Infernal Pact.name: Infernal Pact
spell->Infernal Pact.description:
You make an appeal to a powerful devil, asking it to bind some of its subordinates to your service. If you succeed, the devil sends you its choice of one devil whose level is no more than double infernal pact's rank, two devils whose levels are each at least 2 less than double the spell rank, or three devils whose levels are each at least 3 less than double the spell rank.

Critical Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #weeks]]{1d4 weeks}.

Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}.

Failure Your request is denied.

Critical Failure Not only is your request denied, but the powerful devil sends word of its displeasure to your master.
spell->Infernal Pact.primarycheck: Religion (expert; you must be a devil)

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepatía 100 pies

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Heavy Aura.name: Aura pesada
action->Heavy Aura.description:
10 pies. Una criatura que entre en el aura pesada debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:23]. Luego queda temporalmente inmune durante 10 minutos.

Éxito La criatura no se ve afectada.

Fallo La criatura es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Impedido} mientras permanezca en el área. Si la criatura ya está gravada, es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizado} mientras permanezca dentro del aura.

Fallo crítico Como fallo, pero el efecto persiste durante 3 rondas después de abandonar el aura.

action->Stygian Guardian.name: Guardián estigio
action->Stygian Guardian.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura u objeto dentro del alcance del sarglagón es objetivo de un ataque

Efecto El sarglagón se interpone, dándole a la criatura u objeto @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Standard Cover} contra el ataque (bonificador +2 de circunstancia a la CA), o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Greater Cover} (bonificador +4 de circunstancia a la CA) si el sarglagón ya le estaba otorgando menor cobertura.

action->Drown.name: Ahogar
action->Drown.description:
El sarglagón evoca agua turbia para llenar los pulmones de una criatura que no puede respirar agua a menos de 30 pies. El objetivo debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26].

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo tose agua y es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1} .

Fallo El objetivo está conteniendo la respiración. ElLa única acción que puede realizar es intentar una salvación de Fortaleza contra Ahogarse para expulsar el agua, que es una acción única.

Fallo crítico El objetivo cae @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente} y ​​comienza a asfixiarse. Si el objetivo tiene éxito en su salvación de Fortaleza mientras se asfixia, tose agua y puede volver a respirar.

action->Sarglagon Venom.name: Veneno de Sarglagón
action->Sarglagon Venom.description:
Tiro de salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Duración máxima 6 rondas

Etapa 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] daño y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 1} (1 ronda)

Etapa 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] daño y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 2} (1 ronda)

Deepwater Dhuthorex.name: Dhuthorex de aguas profundas
Deepwater Dhuthorex.publicNotes:
El típico dhuthorex es una bestia muda y hambrienta, que persigue a sus presas en las profundidades y se aventura en la tierra sólo para perseguir presas fáciles.

Cosas extrañas nadan en mares sin sol, pero pocas tan feroces como los dhuthorexes, parecidos a tiburones. Estas bestias persiguen a sus presas sin miedo y con tenacidad.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (impreciso) 60 pies

action->Aquatic Ambush.name: Aquatic Ambush
action->Aquatic Ambush.description:

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AquaticAmbush]

action->Overpowering Jaws.name: Mandíbulas abrumadoras
action->Overpowering Jaws.description: Un dhuthorex de aguas profundas inflige @Damage[7[piercing]] daño a su objetivo si el golpe de sus mandíbulas falla (pero no es un fallo crítico).

action->Swallow Whole.name: Swallow Whole
action->Swallow Whole.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Medio, @Damage[(2d6+7)[bludgeoning] ,2d6[ácido]]{2d6+7 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid damage} , Ruptura 20

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Dhuthorex Sage.name: Salvia Dhuthorex
Dhuthorex Sage.publicNotes:
Más inteligentes que sus parientes menores, los temibles dhuthorexes poseen poderes misteriosos y encantadores.

Cosas extrañas nadan en mares sin sol, pero pocas tan feroces como los dhuthorexes, parecidos a tiburones. Estas bestias persiguen a sus presas sin miedo y con tenacidad.

spell->Cloak of Colors.name: Cloak of Colors
spell->Cloak of Colors.description:
A cloak of swirling colors shrouds the target. Creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} while adjacent to it, and attacking the target causes a brilliant flash of light. A creature that hits the target with a melee attack must attempt a Will save.The creature is temporarily immune until the end of its turn; this effect has the incapacitation trait.

Success The attacker is unaffected.

Failure The attacker is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The attacker is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 round.

spell->Crushing Despair.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]
Desesperación aplastante
spell->Crushing Despair.description:
You inflict despair on creatures in the area. The effects for each creature are determined by its Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the creature can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of its turn; on a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that turn as it sobs uncontrollably.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Heightened (7th) The area increases to a 60-foot cone.

spell->Hallucination.name: Hallucination
spell->Hallucination.description:
The target consistently detects one thing as another, can't detect something that's there, or detects something that's not there, though it doesn't alter their beliefs. You choose which of these effects applies, and you determine the specifics of the hallucination. For example, you could make the target see all elves as humans, be unable to detect the presence of their brother, see their beloved pocket watch on their person even when it isn't, or see a tower in the center of town. The target can attempt an initial Will save, with effects below. They also receive a Will save to disbelieve the hallucination every time they Seek or directly interact with the hallucination. For example, the target could attempt to disbelieve the hallucination each time they interacted with an elf, bumped into their brother accidentally, tried to check their pocket watch, or studied the tower. The target can attempt to disbelieve with a large circumstance bonus in situations determined by the GM, such as if the target attempted to climb the nonexistent tower.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature perceives what you chose until it disbelieves, but it knows what the hallucination is.

Failure The creature perceives what you chose until it disbelieves.

Critical Failure The creature perceives what you chose until it disbelieves, and it trusts its false senses, taking a -4 circumstance penalty to saves to disbelieve.

Heightened (6th) Choose to either target up to 10 creatures or change the spell's duration to until the next time you make your daily preparations.

Heightened (8th) Choose to either target any number of creatures or change the spell's duration to unlimited.

spell->Mariner's Curse.name: Mariner's Curse
spell->Mariner's Curse.description:
You afflict the target with the curse of the roiling, unforgiving sea. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Reducing its Sickened condition to 0 ends the curse.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and can't reduce its Sickened condition below 1 while the curse remains. The curse can be lifted by remove curse or similar magic. Whenever the target is Sickened and on the water at least a mile from shore, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

spell->Confusion.name: Confusion
spell->Confusion.description:
You befuddle your target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. You can Dismiss the spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target babbles incoherently and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

Critical Failure The target is Confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Nightmare.name: Nightmare
spell->Nightmare.description:
You send disturbing nightmares to your target. The next time the target falls asleep, it must attempt a Will save. If you know the target only by name and have never met them, the target gets a +4 circumstance bonus to the Will save.

Critical Success The target suffers no adverse effects and is temporarily immune for 1 week.

Success The target experiences the nightmares but suffers no adverse effects other than unpleasant memories.

Failure The target experiences the nightmares and awakens @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Critical Failure The target experiences the nightmares, awakens Fatigued, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} until it is no longer Fatigued.

spell->Read Omens.name: Read Omens
spell->Read Omens.description: You peek into the future. Choose a particular goal or activity you plan to engage in within 1 week, or an event you expect might happen within 1 week. You learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, often in the form of a rhyme or omen.

spell->Enthrall.name: Enthrall
spell->Enthrall.description:
Your words fascinate your targets. You speak or sing without interruption throughout the casting and duration. Targets who notice your speech or song might give their undivided attention; each target must attempt a Will save. The GM might grant a circumstance bonus (to a maximum of +4) if the target is of an opposing religion, ancestry, or political leaning, or is otherwise unlikely to agree with what you're saying.

Each creature that comes within range has to attempt a save when you Sustain the Spell. If you're speaking, enthrall gains the linguistic trait.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and notices that you tried to use magic.

Success The target needn't pay attention but doesn't notice you tried to use magic (it might notice others are enthralled).

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with you. It can attempt another Will save if it witnesses actions or speech with which it disagrees. If it succeeds, it's no longer Fascinated and is temporarily immune for 1 hour. If the target is subject to a hostile act, or if another creature succeeds at a Diplomacy or Intimidation check against it, the fascination ends immediately.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target can't attempt a save to end the fascination if it disagrees with you.

spell->Hypnotic Pattern.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.K2WpC3FFoHrqX9Q5]
Patrón hipnótico
spell->Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a pattern of shifting colors that hovers in the air in a geometric cloud. Creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} while inside the pattern. In addition, a creature must attempt a Will saving throw if it is inside the pattern when you cast it, when it enters the pattern, when it ends its turn within the pattern, or if it uses a Seek or Interact action on the pattern. A creature currently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the pattern doesn't attempt new saves.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is Fascinated by the pattern.

Critical Failure The target is Fascinated by the pattern. While it remains Fascinated, it can't use reactions.

spell->Mind Reading.name: Mind Reading
spell->Mind Reading.description:
With a cursory mental touch, you attempt to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your mind reading for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target perceives vague surface thoughts from you when you Cast the Spell.

Success You find out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Failure You perceive vague surface thoughts from the target when you Cast the Spell, and you find out whether its Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Critical Failure As failure, and for the duration of the spell, you can Sustain the Spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

spell->Paralyze.name: Paralyze
spell->Paralyze.description:
You block the target's motor impulses before they can leave its mind, threatening to freeze the target in place. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is Paralyzed for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Augury.name: Augury
spell->Augury.description:
You gain a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveals the GM's best guess among the following outcomes:

  • Weal The results will be good.
  • Woe The results will be bad.
  • Weal and Woe The results will be a mix of good and bad.
  • Nothing There won't be particularly good or bad results.

The GM rolls a secret @Check[flat|dc:6|traits:secret]. On a failure, the result is always "nothing." This makes it impossible to tell whether a "nothing" result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it's possible to get a different result.

spell->Death Knell.name: Death Knell
spell->Death Knell.description:
You snuff the life out of a creature on the brink of death. The target must attempt a Will save. If this kills it, you gain 10 temporary HP and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} value increases by 1.

Failure The target dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.98XT2QUk6wvXIqf7]{Spell Effect: Death Knell}

spell->Telekinetic Maneuver.name: Telekinetic Maneuver
spell->Telekinetic Maneuver.description: With a rush of telekinetic power, you move a foe or something they carry. You can attempt to Disarm, Shove, or Trip the target using a spell attack roll instead of an Athletics check.

spell->Bane.name: Bane
spell->Bane.description:
You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt.

Enemies in the area must succeed at a Will save or take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area.

Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bane, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw.

Bane can counteract @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XSujb7EsSwKl19Uu]{Bless}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.UTLp7omqsiC36bso]{Spell Effect: Bane}

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Fear.name: Fear
spell->Fear.description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

spell->Mage Hand.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mano de mago
spell->Mage Hand.description:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
spell->Mage Hand.target: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

spell->Mindlink.name: Mindlink
spell->Mindlink.description: You link your mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

spell->Read Aura.name: Read Aura
spell->Read Aura.description:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.

spell->Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
spell->Sanctuary.description:
You ward a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

Critical Success Sanctuary ends.

Success The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.

Failure The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.

Critical Failure The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (impreciso) 60 pies

action->Frightful Presence.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]

60 pies. @Check[type:will|dc:27]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

action->Aquatic Ambush.description:

Doom of Tomorrow.name: Perdición del mañana
Doom of Tomorrow.description: Los sonidos de devastación se elevan desde el diorama, y ​​un rayo de energía brillante sale disparado desde el pequeño modelo de Gauntlight.
Doom of Tomorrow.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Deactivate Model of Gauntlight|traits:magical,trap] (entrenado) para desactivar rápidamente el modelo de Gauntlight antes de que se active, o @Check[type:stealth|dc:23|name:Creep by Trap|traits:magical,trap] (entrenado) para arrastrarse junto a una trampa sin activarla.
Doom of Tomorrow.reset: Cada trampa se reinicia automáticamente después de 1 hora.

action->Apocalypse Beam.name: Haz de Apocalipsis
action->Apocalypse Beam.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura camina a 10 pies de la parte trasera de un nicho de diorama

Efecto La trampa dispara un rayo apocalíptico a esa criatura.

Dragon's Blood Puffball.name: Puffball de sangre de dragón
Dragon's Blood Puffball.publicNotes:
Este hongo bulboso de color rojo intenso parece una enorme rosa en descomposición.

Muchos hongos bejines benignos se aferran a los detritos del suelo del bosque en las cavernas de las Tierras Oscuras. Las versiones gigantes de estos hongos son más móviles y peligrosas.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Sensor de movimiento 60 pies
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: El monstruo siente el movimiento a través de vibraciones y movimiento del aire.

action->Spore Explosion.name: Explosión de esporas
action->Spore Explosion.description: Cuando la bola de sangre de dragón muere, explota, causando @Damage[7d8[poison]] daño a cada criatura en una @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] ( @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true] salvación).

Dread Dhuthorex.name: Pavor Dhuthorex
Dread Dhuthorex.publicNotes:
Más inteligentes que sus parientes menores, los temibles dhuthorexes poseen poderes misteriosos y encantadores.

Cosas extrañas nadan en mares sin sol, pero pocas tan feroces como los dhuthorexes, parecidos a tiburones. Estas bestias persiguen a sus presas sin miedo y con tenacidad.

The curse can be lifted by remove curse or similar magic. action->Swallow Whole.name: Swallow Whole
action->Swallow Whole.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Grande, @Damage[(3d6+8)[bludgeoning] ,2d6[ácido]]{3d6+8 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid damage} , Ruptura 23

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Dread Wisp.name: Fuego fatuo
Dread Wisp.publicNotes:
Los fuegos fatuos nativos de las Tierras Oscuras son más siniestros y malévolos que los que merodean en las solitarias marismas y superficies del mundo superior. Estas temibles volutas infunden terror con espeluznantes cambios de luz y consumen el miedo que crean, extrayendo energía vital de sus víctimas en el proceso. Si bien las temibles llamas pueden sobrevivir en cualquier lugar de las Tierras Oscuras, prefieren áreas húmedas como cuevas parcialmente sumergidas, orillas de ríos subterráneos e imponentes jardines de hongos.

Las temibles volutas no brillan tanto como los fuegos fatuos de la superficie porque incluso la luz más tenue atrae la atención bajo tierra. Criaturas longevas y odiosas, recuerdan vívidos detalles de sus vidas, viajes y sus presas más deliciosas. Aunque los temibles fuegos artificiales podrían compartir una extensa tradición y experiencias únicas, no lo hacen, ya que se divierten con la ignorancia de los demás.

action->Dread Flickering.name: Parpadeo aterrador
action->Dread Flickering.description:
20 pies. Una temible brizna, aunque naturalmente invisible, brilla con una iluminación grisácea, proyectando una luz tenue en el aura y haciéndola visible. Las criaturas vivientes que terminan su turno en el aura deben superar una tirada de salvación @Check[type:will|dc:25] o convertirse en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 1} (o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 2} en caso de fallo crítico).

Aquellos que tienen éxito crítico son temporalmente inmunes durante 10 minutos.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Inmunidad mágica
action->Magic Immunity.description: Una llama aterradora es inmune a todos los hechizos excepto @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DyiD239dNS7RIxZE]{Holy Light} y ​​hechizos con el rasgo de vitalidad.

action->Feed on Despair.name: Alimentarse de la desesperación
action->Feed on Despair.description:
Frecuencia una vez por ronda

Requisito Un enemigo dentro de 15 pies del temible fuego fatuo está bajo un efecto de miedo, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Moribundo}

Efecto La temible llama se alimenta de la desesperación de la criatura. El fuego fatuo recupera [[/r 2d8[healing]]] puntos de vida e inflige @Damage[3d8[void]] daño a la criatura ( @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] salvación), y siel temible fuego se ha vuelto oscuro, su terror parpadeante se reaviva.

action->Go Dark.name: Ir a la oscuridad
action->Go Dark.description: La llama aterradora extingue su parpadeo aterrador y se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} . Pueden finalizar este efecto con otro uso de esta acción. Si la llama aterradora usa su toque drenante Golpe mientras es invisible, el arco de energía pálida permite a cualquier observador determinar su ubicación, haciéndolos @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Escondido} para todos los observadores solo hasta que la llama aterradora se mueva.

action->Shadow Flitter.name: Revoloteo de sombras
action->Shadow Flitter.description: La temible llama se teletransporta a un cuadrado que pueden ver dentro de 30 pies y que no está en un área de luz brillante. La temible brizna no se puede volver a usar para [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Shadow Flitter]]{1d4 rounds} .

action->Wearying Touch.name: Toque cansado
action->Wearying Touch.description: Si la llama aterradora golpea críticamente con su toque drenante Golpe, el objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1} .

Dreshkan.name: Dreshkan
Dreshkan.publicNotes:
Debido a que los morlocks descienden de ancestros humanos lejanos, deformar la carne de un morlock de manera torpe o apresurada simplemente produce un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.K9Hw43co8fhwmKkM]{Grothlut} . Sin embargo, los hábiles deformadores de carne pueden descubrir las diferencias genéticas de un morlock para crear una criatura completamente diferente. Crear un dreshkan implica reemplazar los huesos del morlock con un esqueleto de metal. Este nuevo esqueleto suele estar muy aumentado, por ejemplo con extremidades en forma de araña que sobresalen de la columna o cargadores de agujas diminutas y mortales.A partir de entonces, una electricidad arcana recorre el dreshkan, volviéndolo nervioso e irritable.

Los Morlocks ven a los dreshkans como fusiones impresionantes de carne y tecnología y con gusto luchan junto a estas criaturas, a quienes ven como modelos del potencial morlock.

Aunque retorcer a las víctimas para darles formas horribles es un conocido pasatiempo de los malvados drow, otros monstruos subterráneos han robado estas prácticas o las han desarrollado de forma independiente. Ellos seugathis con forma de gusano a veces deforman a otras criaturas cuyos territorios lindan con sus tierras sin luz; Las deformaciones de carne a continuación son el resultado de morlocks y urdefhans, respectivamente.
Dreshkan.saveDetails: +2 de estado a todas las salvaciones contra sangrado, efectos de muerte, enfermedad, condenado, fatigado, paralizado, envenenado y enfermo

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Bleed.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+2 de estado a todas las salvaciones contra sangrado, efectos de muerte, enfermedad, condenado, fatigado, paralizado, venenoso, enfermo

action->Defensive Needle.name: Aguja defensiva
action->Defensive Needle.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura falla críticamente un golpe cuerpo a cuerpo contra el dreshkan

Efecto El dreshkan hace un golpe con aguja contra esa criatura.

action->Partially Technological.name: Parcialmente Tecnológico
action->Partially Technological.description: Un dreshkan es parcialmente tecnológico. Los efectos curativos de vitalidad solo curan a un dreshkan la mitad de lo normal.

action->Needle Spray.name: Pulverizador de aguja
action->Needle Spray.description: El dreshkan se apoya en las cuatro extremidades y rocía agujas a tantas criaturas como quiera en un @Template[type:cone|distance:30], causando @Damage[2d4[piercing], 2d8[electricidad]]{2d4 piercing damage plus 2d8 electricity damage}. Cada criatura objetivo en el área debe intentar un @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true].

action->Swarming Stance.name: Postura de enjambre
action->Swarming Stance.description: Un dreshkan puede compartir el mismo espacio que un morlock u otro dreshkan, pero no más de dos de esas criaturas pueden ocupar el mismo espacio. Cuando estas criaturas comparten el mismo espacio, obtienen un bono de circunstancia +1 a las tiradas de ataque.

Drill Field Barbazu.name: Campo de perforación Barbazu
Drill Field Barbazu.publicNotes:
Barbazus, conocidos también como demonios barbudos o demonios de infantería, son demonios asesinos que sacian su ansia de aniquilación sirviendo como soldados de infantería de los ejércitos del Infierno, a menudo liderando hordas de demonios menores como diablillos y lémures a la batalla. Los demonios barbudos empuñan gujas dentadas para infligir cortes dentados que resisten la magia curativa, lo que provoca una tremenda pérdida de sangre. Cuando los enemigos se acercan demasiado, los demonios barbudos golpean con las espinas de sus barbas retorcidas para entregar un desdichadocontagio llamado fiebre Avernal, saboreando la visión de la fuerza de su víctima siendo devorada lentamente desde dentro.

Se puede encontrar a Barbazus complaciendo salvajemente los caprichos de los malvados señores infernales de todas las capas del infierno, regocijándose mientras diseminan asesinatos, miseria y angustia como mejor les parezca.

Maestros de la corrupción y arquitectos de la conquista, los demonios buscan tentar a la vida mortal para que se una en su búsqueda de todas las cosas profanas yextender la tiranía por todos los mundos. Las tentaciones que ofrecen a los mortales van desde grandes poderes otorgados mediante la firma de un contrato infernal hasta favores retorcidos tras una promesa susurrada a un patrón diabólico, o cualquier número de intercambios aún más sutiles. Aquellos que sucumben a estas tentaciones se encuentran condenados a una vida futura de tormento sin fin en los pozos del infierno, donde la única esperanza de escapar reside en la posibilidad de ser promovidos a convertirse en un demonio en las filas infernales. Cada diablo tieneun papel específico que desempeñar en el mantenimiento de la implacable máquina burocrática que es el infierno, desde soldados y eruditos hasta inquisidores, abogados, jueces y verdugos. Los humildes lémures y diablillos realizan trabajos subordinados a demonios más poderosos y especializados, como los demonios contratados y los erinyes, mientras que los mayores demonios del abismo comandan ejércitos infernales enteros.
Drill Field Barbazu.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones vs. magia

spell->Dimension Door.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Puerta de dimensión
spell->Dimension Door.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

spell->Dimension Door (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Puerta dimensional (a voluntad)
spell->Dimension Door (At Will).description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

spell->Infernal Pact.name: Infernal Pact
spell->Infernal Pact.description:
You make an appeal to a powerful devil, asking it to bind some of its subordinates to your service. If you succeed, the devil sends you its choice of one devil whose level is no more than double infernal pact's rank, two devils whose levels are each at least 2 less than double the spell rank, or three devils whose levels are each at least 3 less than double the spell rank.

Critical Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #weeks]]{1d4 weeks}.

Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}.

Failure Your request is denied.

Critical Failure Not only is your request denied, but the powerful devil sends word of its displeasure to your master.
spell->Infernal Pact.primarycheck: Religion (expert; you must be a devil)

weapon->Glaive.name: Glaive
weapon->Glaive.description: This polearm consists of a long, single-edged blade on the end of a 7-foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.

equipment->Drover's Band.name: Drover's Band
equipment->Drover's Band.description:
This black leather wrist guard has a bright red gem on the inside of the wrist. Faint glyphs and words of domination in Infernal swim inside the gem. Your words become harsh and clipped when you have this magic item invested.

Activate 3 command

Frequency once per day

Effect You exert your will over a mindless creature within 30 feet. If the target is a mindless creature of 3rd level or lower, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save. If you are a devil, the target uses an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its saving throw.

Critical Success The target creature is unaffected.

Success The target creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round as its responses are muddled by your commands.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} by you for 1 hour, although it doesn't follow commands that are obviously self-destructive.

Critical Failure As failure, but the duration is 1 day.

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepatía 100 pies

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Avernal Fever.name: Fiebre avernal
action->Avernal Fever.description:
Tiro de salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Etapa 1 portador sin efectos nocivos (1 día)

Etapa 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 1} (1 día)

Etapa 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 2} (1 día)

action->Drover's Band.name: Banda de pastores
action->Drover's Band.description:
Activar comando

Frecuencia una vez al día

Efecto El Barbazu ejerce su voluntad sobre una criatura sin sentido a menos de 30 pies. Si el objetivo es una criatura estúpida de nivel 3 o inferior, debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:20] y ​​utiliza un resultado un grado de éxito peor que el resultado de su tirada de salvación.

Éxito crítico La criatura objetivo no se ve afectada.

Éxito La criatura objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} durante 1 ronda ya que sus respuestas se ven confusas por las órdenes de Barbazu.

Fallo La criatura es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlado} por el Barbazu durante 1 hora, aunque no sigue órdenes que obviamente son autodestructivas.

Fallo Crítico Como fallo, pero la duración es de 1 día.

action->Infernal Wound.name: Herida infernal
action->Infernal Wound.description:
El golpe con guja de un diablo barbudo también inflige @Damage[1d6[bleed]] que resiste los intentos de curarlo.

El cheque plano para detener el sangrado comienza en @Check[type:flat|dc:20] . La CD se reduce a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] sólo si la criatura sangrante o un aliado ayuda con éxito con la recuperación. La CD para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} a una criatura con una herida infernal se incrementa en 5.

Un lanzador de hechizos o un objeto que intenta usar magia curativa en una criatura.que sufre una herida infernal debe superar una prueba de contraataque CD 21 o la magia no podrá curar a la criatura.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.inLBsuLRE5xmVHdn]{Effect: Infernal Wound}

action->Reposition.name: Reposicionar
action->Reposition.description:
Desencadenante El diablo golpea a una criatura con un golpe con guja.

Efecto El diablo mueve la criatura 5 pies en cualquier dirección. La casilla de destino debe estar al alcance de la guja del diablo.

Este movimiento no provoca reacciones.

action->Wriggling Beard.name: Barba retorcida
action->Wriggling Beard.description:
Frecuencia una vez por ronda.

Efecto El barbazu hace un Golpe de barba. Este Golpe ignora su penalización por ataque múltiple y no cuenta para esa penalización.

Drow Cavern Seer.name: Vidente de la caverna drow
Drow Cavern Seer.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones versus magia, +2 estado a todas las salvaciones versus mentales

spell->Commune.name: Commune
spell->Commune.cost: rare incense worth a total value of 150 gp
spell->Commune.description:
You call upon an unknown planar entity to answer questions; this is a servitor of your deity if you have one and use Religion. You can ask up to seven questions that could be answered with "Yes" or "No." The entity is likely to know answers related to its purview; a servitor of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.swwwP7eVmlNuWTb7]{Gozreh} would likely know about unnatural weather patterns and a servitor of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.JgqH3BhuEuA4Zyqs]{Desna} would likely know someone's travel route. The entity answers with one word answers such as "Yes," "No," "Likely," and "Unknown," though its answers always reflect its own agenda and could be deceptive.

Critical Success You contact a more powerful entity aligned strongly with your interests, possibly even your deity. The entity won't attempt to deceive you, though it still might not know the answers. When it's important to provide clarity, the entity will answer your questions with up to five words, such as "If you leave immediately" or "That was true once."

Success You can ask your questions and receive answers.

Failure You fail to contact a planar entity.

Critical Failure You are exposed to the enormity of the cosmos and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} for 1 week (can't remove by any means).
spell->Commune.secondarycheck: Ocultismo o Religión (lo que se utilice para la verificación principal)

spell->Black Tentacles.name: Black Tentacles
spell->Black Tentacles.description:
Area 20-foot burst adjacent to a flat surface

Oily black tentacles rise up and attempt to capture creatures in the area. Make spell attack rolls against the Fortitude DC of each creature in the area. Any creature you succeed against is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage. Whenever a creature ends its turn in the area, the tentacles attempt to grab that creature if they haven't already, and they deal @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage to any creature already Grabbed.

The tentacles' Escape DC is equal to your spell DC. A creature can attack a tentacle in an attempt to release its grip. Its AC is equal to your spell DC, and it is destroyed if it takes 12 or more damage. Even if destroyed, additional tentacles continue to grow in the area until the duration ends. You can Dismiss the spell.

spell->Ectoplasmic Expulsion.name: Ectoplasmic Expulsion
spell->Ectoplasmic Expulsion.description: You call upon tendrils of ephemeral ectoplasm to pass through the target and carry away a harmful psychic affliction. You immediately attempt to counteract a single effect on the target with the emotion or possession trait, or an effect giving the target the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} condition. If you fail to counteract the effect, you nevertheless set up a resonance that allows the target to more ably escape the effect on its own; for the next hour, the target gains a +2 status bonus to Will saves to shrug off the effect you failed to counteract (such as Will saves to shake off control by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell).

spell->Prying Eye.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]
Ojo curioso
spell->Prying Eye.description: You create an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, floating eye, 1 inch in diameter, at a location you can see within 500 feet. It sees in all directions with your normal visual senses and continuously transmits what it sees to you. The first time you Sustain the Spell each round, you can either move the eye up to 30 feet, seeing only things in front of the eye, or move it up to 10 feet, seeing everything in all directions around it. There is no limit to how far from you the eye can move, but the spell ends immediately if you and the eye ever cease to be on the same plane of existence. You can attempt Seek actions through the eye if you want to attempt Perception checks with it. Any damage dealt to the eye destroys it and ends the spell.

spell->Dimension Door.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Puerta de dimensión
spell->Dimension Door.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

spell->Globe of Invulnerability.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.JOdOpbPDl7nqvJUm]
Globo de invulnerabilidad
spell->Globe of Invulnerability.description:
You create an immobile globe around yourself that attempts to counteract any spell from outside the globe whose area or targets enter into the globe, as if the globe were a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell 1 rank lower than its actual spell rank.

If the counteract attempt succeeds, it prevents only the portion of the spell that would have entered the globe (so if the spell also has targets outside the globe, or part of its area is beyond the globe, those targets or that area is affected normally).

You must form the sphere in an unbroken open space, so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost (though creatures can enter the globe after the spell is cast).

spell->Outcast's Curse.name: Outcast's Curse
spell->Outcast's Curse.description:
You afflict the target with a curse that makes its presence abrasive and off-putting. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success For 10 minutes, the target must roll twice and use the worse result whenever attempting a Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance check, and creatures they encounter have an initial attitude toward them of one step worse (for instance, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{Unfriendly} instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent}).

Failure As success, but the effect is permanent.

Critical Failure As failure, and creatures that the target encounters have an initial attitude toward them of two steps worse.

spell->Blindness.name: Blindness
spell->Blindness.description:
You blind the target. The effect is determined by the target's Fortitude save. The target then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until its next turn begins.

Failure The target is Blinded for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is Blinded permanently.

spell->Geas.name: Geas
spell->Geas.description:
You enforce a magic rule on a willing target, forcing it to either perform or refrain from carrying out a certain act. A geas to perform an act is usually conditional, such as, "Always offer hospitality to strangers seeking a place to stay." An unconditional geas to perform a certain act doesn't require the target to perform that act exclusively, though it must prioritize the task above all leisurely pursuits. The most common geas to refrain from carrying out an act is a specification to avoid violating a contract. In those cases, the secondary caster usually takes charge of making sure the wording of the contract is attuned correctly with the ritual's magic. Because the target is willing, geas can have a duration that lasts for as long as the target agrees to. If the target is unable to fulfill the geas, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and the sickened condition increases by 1 for each consecutive day it is prevented from following the geas, to a maximum of sickened 4. The sickened condition ends immediately when it follows the geas again; it can't remove the sickened condition in any other way. Only powerful magic such as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual can remove the effects of geas from a willing target.

Critical Success The geas succeeds, and the target receives a +1 status bonus to skill checks that directly uphold the geas (at the GM's discretion).

Success The geas succeeds.

Failure The geas fails.

Critical Failure The geas fails, and you are instead affected by the geas you were attempting to place on the target. You are considered an unwilling target, so the geas can be counteracted with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} spell.

Heightened (5th) You can use geas on an unwilling creature; it can attempt a Will save to negate the effect. If the target fails this Will save, the geas lasts up to 1 week. A cleanse affliction spell can counteract a geas on an unwilling creature, in addition to powerful magic such as a wish ritual. A clever unwilling creature can subvert the geas by contriving situations that prevent it from complying, but in that case it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} (as described above).

Heightened (7th) As 5th rank, but the geas lasts for up to 1 year on an unwilling creature.

Heightened (9th) As 5th rank, but the geas lasts for a duration you choose (even unlimited) on an unwilling creature.
spell->Geas.target: 1 criatura de un nivel no mayor al doble del nivel del ritual geas

spell->Heroism.name: Heroism
spell->Heroism.description:
You tap into the target's inner heroism, granting it a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks.

Heightened (6th) The status bonus increases to +2.

Heightened (9th) The status bonus increases to +3.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.l9HRQggofFGIxEse]{Spell Effect: Heroism}

spell->Slow.name: Slow
spell->Slow.description:
You dilate the flow of time around the target, slowing its actions.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 minute.

Heightened (6th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Wanderer's Guide.name: Wanderer's Guide
spell->Wanderer's Guide.description: You call upon the beyond to guide your route. When you Cast this Spell, choose a destination; you receive an inspired route to that destination, allowing you and allies who travel overland with you to reduce the movement penalty from difficult terrain by half for the duration, as long as you don't deviate from the inspired route. This doesn't have any effect on movement during encounters. If you use this ability again before the duration is over, this effect ends and is replaced by that of the new route.

spell->Augury.name: Augury
spell->Augury.description:
You gain a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveals the GM's best guess among the following outcomes:

  • Weal The results will be good.
  • Woe The results will be bad.
  • Weal and Woe The results will be a mix of good and bad.
  • Nothing There won't be particularly good or bad results.

The GM rolls a secret @Check[flat|dc:6|traits:secret]. On a failure, the result is always "nothing." This makes it impossible to tell whether a "nothing" result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it's possible to get a different result.

spell->Darkness (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]
Oscuridad (a voluntad)
spell->Darkness (At Will).description:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

spell->Faerie Fire (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]
Fuego de hadas (a voluntad)
spell->Faerie Fire (At Will).description: All creatures in the area when you cast the spell are limned in colorful, heatless fire of a color of your choice for the duration. Visible creatures can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire. If the creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, they are Concealed while affected by faerie fire, rather than being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}.

spell->False Life.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8ViwItUgwT4lOvvb]
vida falsa
spell->False Life.description:
You create a reservoir of vitality from necromantic energy, gaining a number of temporary Hit Points equal to 6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The temporary Hit Points increase by 3.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.PANUWN5xXC20WBg2]{Spell Effect: False Life}

spell->Invisibility.name: Invisibility
spell->Invisibility.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

spell->Paranoia.name: Paranoia
spell->Paranoia.description:
You cause the target to see all other creatures as dire threats. The target is stricken by intense paranoia toward all creatures around it and must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target believes everyone it sees is a potential threat. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{Unfriendly} to all creatures to which it wasn't already hostile, even those that were previously allies. It treats no one as an ally. The spell ends after 1 round.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target believes that everyone it sees is a mortal enemy. It uses its reactions and free actions against everyone, regardless of whether they were previously its allies, as determined by the GM. It otherwise acts as rationally as it normally does and likely prefers to attack creatures that are actively attacking or hindering it over those leaving it alone.

Heightened (6th) You can target up to 5 creatures.

spell->Sound Burst.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]
Explosión de sonido
spell->Sound Burst.description:
A cacophonous noise blasts out, dealing 2d10 sonic damage. Each creature must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is Deafened for 1 minute, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

spell->Bless.name: Bless
spell->Bless.description:
Blessings from beyond help your companions strike true. You and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls while within the emanation. Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bless, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet.

Bless can counteract @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7ZinJNzxq0XF0oMx]{Bane}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.RfCEHpMoEAZvB9IZ]{Aura: Bless}
spell->Bless.target: you and allies in the area

spell->Chill Touch.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]
Toque frío
spell->Chill Touch.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.

spell->Command.name: Command
spell->Command.description:
You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition), release what it's holding, drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Luces danzantes
spell->Dancing Lights.description: Creas hasta cuatro luces flotantes, ninguna de las cuales está a más de 10 pies de distancia. Cada uno arroja luz como una antorcha. Cuando sostienes el hechizo, puedes mover cualquier cantidad de luces hasta 60 pies. Cada luz debe permanecer a 120 pies de usted y a 10 pies de todas las demás, o parpadeará.

spell->Daze.name: Daze
spell->Daze.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Grim Tendrils.name: Grim Tendrils
spell->Grim Tendrils.description:
Tendrils of darkness curl out from your fingertips and race through the air. You deal 2d4 void damage and @Damage[(@item.level)[bleed]] damage to living creatures in the line. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half the void damage and no persistent bleed damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double void damage and double persistent bleed damage.

Heightened (+1) The void damage increases by 2d4, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

spell->Know Direction.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tXa5vOu5giBNCjdR]
Conozca la dirección
spell->Know Direction.description:
In your mind's eye, you see a path northward. You immediately know which direction is north (if it exists at your current location).

Heightened (7th) You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.

spell->Mending.name: Mending
spell->Mending.description:
You repair the target item. You restore 5 Hit Points per spell rank to the target, potentially removing the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} condition if this repairs it past the item's Broken Threshold. You can't replace lost pieces or repair an object that's been completely destroyed.

Heightened (2nd) You can target a non-magical object of 1 Bulk or less.

Heightened (3rd) You can target a non-magical object of 2 Bulk or less, or a magical object of 1 Bulk or less.
spell->Mending.target: non-magical object of light Bulk or less

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

weapon->Staff.name: Staff
weapon->Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

equipment->Wand of Manifold Missiles (1s.name: Wand of Manifold Missiles (1st-Rank Spell)
equipment->Wand of Manifold Missiles (1s.description:
This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} at 1st rank.

After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of magic missile of the appropriate rank.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 estado a todas las partidas guardadas contra Magic

action->+2 Status To All Saves vs. Menta.name: +2 Estado a todas las salvaciones vs. Mental

action->Stone Defense.name: Defensa de piedra
action->Stone Defense.description:
Desencadenante Un enemigo está a punto de dañar al vidente de la caverna con un daño contundente o con un hechizo que tiene el rasgo de tierra

Efecto El vidente de cavernas gana resistencia 10 contra el daño desencadenante.

action->Cavern Distortion.name: Distorsión de caverna
action->Cavern Distortion.description:
Frecuencia una vez al día

Requisitos El vidente de la caverna está bajo tierra

Efecto De la piedra se levantan guijarros y polvo que impiden la visión. El vidente de cavernas y sus aliados en un radio de 60 pies quedan ocultos durante 1 minuto.

Este ocultamiento no se puede utilizar para esconderse o escabullirse.

action->Underground Stride.name: Paso subterráneo
action->Underground Stride.description: El vidente de cavernas ignora el terreno difícil mientras está bajo tierra.

Drow Hunter.name: Cazador drow
Drow Hunter.publicNotes:
Los cazadores buscan animales para mantener alimentadas y funcionando a las comunidades drows.

Los drow tienen reputación de malvados debido al culto a los demonios en sus principales asentamientos. Sin embargo, como los miembros de cualquier ascendencia, los drow pueden tener cualquier alineamiento, especialmente cuando están alejados de la siniestra influencia de los señores demonios.
Drow Hunter.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones versus magia, +2 estado a todas las salvaciones versus mentales

spell->Darkness (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]

Cuando sostienes el hechizo, puedes mover cualquier cantidad de luces hasta 60 pies. Cada luz debe permanecer a 120 pies de usted y a 10 pies de todas las demás, o parpadeará.

weapon->Composite Longbow.name: Composite Longbow
weapon->Composite Longbow.description: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Longsword.name: Longsword
weapon->Longsword.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Las espadas largas pueden ser espadas de uno o dos filos. Sus hojas son pesadas y miden entre 3 y 4 pies de largo.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Menta.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+2 Estado a todas las salvaciones vs. Mental

action->Deft Evasion.name: Evasión hábil
action->Deft Evasion.description: Cuando el cazador obtiene un éxito en una salvación de Reflejos, en su lugar obtiene un éxito crítico.

action->Hunter's Wound.name: La herida del cazador
action->Hunter's Wound.description:
Frecuencia una vez por ronda

Prerrequisitos El cazador empuña un arma a distancia con una recarga de 0

Efecto El cazador realiza dos ataques a distancia contra su presa. Si ambos golpean e infligen daño, el objetivo sufre @Damage[1d8[bleed]].

action->Skirmish Strike.name: Golpe de escaramuza
action->Skirmish Strike.description: El cazador puede dar un paso y luego atacar, o golpear y luego dar un paso.

Drow Shootist.name: Tirador drow
Drow Shootist.publicNotes:
Los pocos drow que se especializan en la ballesta de mano de repetición inspiran respeto no sólo por sus habilidades sino también por su suerte y arrogancia.

Los drow tienen reputación de malvados debido al culto a los demonios en sus principales asentamientos. Sin embargo, como los miembros de cualquier ascendencia, los drow pueden tener cualquier alineamiento, especialmente cuando están alejados de la siniestra influencia de los señores demonios.
Drow Shootist.saveDetails: +1 estado a todas las salvaciones versus magia, +2 estado a todas las salvaciones versus mentales

Cuando sostienes el hechizo, puedes mover cualquier cantidad de luces hasta 60 pies. Cada luz debe permanecer a 120 pies de usted y a 10 pies de todas las demás, o parpadeará.

weapon->Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow
weapon->Repeating Hand Crossbow.description: This handheld crossbow features an ingeniously designed catch mechanism at the top of the flight groove, just in front of the latch, which automatically loads a bolt from a magazine and resets the string each time the weapon is fired. A typical repeating hand crossbow magazine holds five bolts.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment->Shootist Bandolier.name: Shootist Bandolier
equipment->Shootist Bandolier.description: This leather bandolier holds up to three @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.xk9bw9ccupAIx7xT]{Repeating Hand Crossbow Magazines} in leather pockets that pop open with the quick flick of a thumb. You reduce the reload time for a repeating hand crossbow magazine from the bandolier by 1, to a total of 2 actions. You can wear only one shootist bandolier at a time.

consumable->Stupor Poison.name: Stupor Poison
consumable->Stupor Poison.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nn2HAN1XKkKHfVnM]

Activar 2 Interactuar

El veneno de estupor es una destilación más potente de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zo0ophqfKunJFxZN]{Lethargy Poison}. Una mayor exposición al veneno de estupor no requiere que el objetivo intente tiradas de salvación adicionales; Sólo fallar una tirada de salvación contra una exposición en curso puede avanzar en su etapa.

Tiro de salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Duración máxima 6 horas

Etapa 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} y ​​@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} (1 ronda)

Etapa 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 2} y ​​con la guardia baja (1 asalto)

Etapa 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente} sin control de Percepción para despertar (1ronda)

Etapa 4 inconsciente sin control de Percepción para despertar ( [[/r 1d6 #hours]]{1d6 hours} )

strike-ranged->Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Ballesta de mano de repetición
strike-ranged->Repeating Hand Crossbow.description: Recarga 2 para recarga del cargador ( @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oJZe5rRitvioUgRh]{Shootist Bandolier} )

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Menta.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+2 Estado a todas las salvaciones vs. Mental

action->Shootist's Luck.name: La suerte del tirador
action->Shootist's Luck.description:
Desencadenante El tirador falla una salvación

Frecuencia una vez al día

Efecto El tirador vuelve a tirar la partida guardada y usa el mejor resultado.

action->Distracting Shot.name: Disparo que distrae
action->Distracting Shot.description: El tirador apunta y realiza un ataque a distancia. Si el ataque impacta y causa daño, el objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} hasta el final del turno del tirador, o hasta el final del siguiente turno del tirador en un golpe crítico.

action->Reloading Trick.name: Truco de recarga
action->Reloading Trick.description:
Requisitos El tirador sostiene una ballesta de mano de repetición descargada

Efecto El tirador interactúa para recargar la ballesta de mano de repetición y golpea con ella.

action->Shootist's Draw.name: Sorteo del tirador
action->Shootist's Draw.description:
Frecuencia una vez por ronda

Efecto El tirador interactúa para sacar una ballesta de mano de repetición y golpea con ella, o golpea con una ballesta de mano de repetición cargada que está sosteniendo y luego interactúa para guardarla.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

El tirador inflige 2d6 de daño de precisión adicional a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} criaturas.

Drow Warden.name: Guardián drow
Drow Warden.publicNotes:
Los guardianes vigilan los campamentos drows y a menudo trabajan en pequeños grupos.
