action->Infernal Wound.name: Herida infernal
action->Infernal Wound.description:
El golpe con guja de un diablo barbudo también inflige @Damage[1d6[bleed]] que resiste los intentos de curarlo.

El cheque plano para detener el sangrado comienza en @Check[type:flat|dc:20] . La CD se reduce a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] sólo si la criatura sangrante o un aliado ayuda con éxito con la recuperación. La CD para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} a una criatura con una herida infernal se incrementa en 5.

Un lanzador de hechizos o un objeto que intenta usar magia curativa en una criatura.que sufre una herida infernal debe superar una prueba de contraataque CD 21 o la magia no podrá curar a la criatura.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.inLBsuLRE5xmVHdn]{Effect: Infernal Wound}

action->Reposition.name: Reposicionar
action->Reposition.description:
Desencadenante El diablo golpea a una criatura con un golpe con guja.

Efecto El diablo mueve la criatura 5 pies en cualquier dirección. La casilla de destino debe estar al alcance de la guja del diablo.

Este movimiento no provoca reacciones.

action->Wriggling Beard.name: Barba retorcida
action->Wriggling Beard.description:
Frecuencia una vez por ronda.

Efecto El barbazu hace un Golpe de barba. Este Golpe ignora su penalización por ataque múltiple y no cuenta para esa penalización.

Images of Failure.name: Imágenes de fracaso
Images of Failure.description: Ilusiones psíquicamente mejoradas inundan las mentes de las criaturas en el pasillo de 40 pies de largo y 15 pies de ancho (el cuadro de puntos blancos en el mapa) con recuerdos de sus fracasos pasados.
Images of Failure.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:32|name:Weaken the images] (maestro) o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5to nivel; contrarrestar CD 26) para debilitar las imágenes; Se requieren tres éxitos para desactivar la trampa
Images of Failure.reset: La trampa se reinicia inmediatamente y puede afectar a la misma criatura varias veces en su turno.
Images of Failure.stealth: (experto) para darse cuenta de que las imágenes ilusorias ocultan una trampa mágica (al notar las imágenes tiene un DC de 0)

action->Echoes of Defeat.name: Ecos de derrota
action->Echoes of Defeat.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura finaliza una acción de movimiento dentro del área de la trampa

Efecto La criatura desencadenante sufre @Damage[(2d10+10)[mental]] daño ( @Check[type:will|dc:32|basic:true] salvación) mientras recuerda sus fracasos pasados. Una criatura que sufre daño escucha un suave susurro que ofrece: "Déjame quitarte algo y puedo detener el dolor". Una criatura que acepta pierde el acceso a una dote de habilidad aleatoria que no es un requisito previo para otra dote.y la criatura no recibe más daño de Echoes of Defeat. Este efecto dura 1 semana y puede finalizar con efectos que eliminan maldiciones.

Images of Powerlessness.name: Imágenes de impotencia
Images of Powerlessness.description: Ilusiones psíquicamente mejoradas inundan las mentes de las criaturas en el pasillo de 95 pies de largo y 15 pies de ancho (el cuadro de puntos blancos en el mapa) con visiones de sus fracasos aún por venir.
Images of Powerlessness.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:32|name:Weaken the images] (maestro) o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5to nivel; contrarrestar CD 26) para debilitar las imágenes; Se requieren tres éxitos para desactivar la trampa
Images of Powerlessness.reset: La trampa se reinicia inmediatamente y puede afectar a la misma criatura varias veces en su turno.
Images of Powerlessness.stealth: (experto) para darse cuenta de que las imágenes ilusorias ocultan una trampa mágica (al notar las imágenes tiene un DC de 0)

action->Flood of Despair.name: Inundación de desesperación
action->Flood of Despair.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura finaliza una acción de movimiento dentro del área de la trampa

Efecto La criatura desencadenante sufre @Damage[(2d10+10)[mental]] daño ( @Check[type:will|dc:32|basic:true] salvación) mientras considera sus fracasos futuros. Una criatura que sufre daño escucha un suave susurro que ofrece: "Déjame quitarte algo y puedo detener el dolor". Una criatura que acepta pierde el acceso a una dote de clase aleatoria que no es un requisito previo para otra.hazaña, y la criatura no recibe más daño de Flood of Despair. Este efecto dura 1 semana y puede finalizar con efectos que eliminan maldiciones. La criatura también detecta inmediatamente la puerta secreta al final del pasillo, sin importar qué tan lejos estén del final del pasillo.

spell->Confusion.name: Confusion
spell->Confusion.description:
You befuddle your target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. You can Dismiss the spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target babbles incoherently and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

Critical Failure The target is Confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
spell->Phantasmal Killer.description:
You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the target. Only the spell's target can see the killer, though you can see the vague shape of the illusion as it races forth to attack. The effect of the killer is based on the outcome of the target's Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes 4d6 mental damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target takes 8d6 mental damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is so afraid it might die. It must attempt a Fortitude save; if the target fails, it dies. On a successful Fortitude save, the target takes 12d6 mental damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} until the end of its next turn, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}. This effect has the incapacitation trait.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6 on a failure and by 3d6 on a critical failure.

spell->Hypercognition.name: Hypercognition
spell->Hypercognition.description: You rapidly catalog and collate information relevant to your current situation. You can instantly use up to 6 Recall Knowledge actions as part of Casting this Spell. For these actions, you can't use any special abilities, reactions, or free actions that trigger when you Recall Knowledge.

spell->Levitate.name: Levitate
spell->Levitate.description:
You defy gravity and levitate the target 5 feet off the ground. You can Sustain the spell to move the target up or down 10 feet. A creature floating in the air from levitate takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls. A floating creature can spend an Interact action to stabilize itself and negate this penalty for the remainder of its turn. If the target is adjacent to a fixed object or terrain of suitable stability, it can move across the surface by climbing (if the surface is vertical, like a wall) or crawling (if the surface is horizontal, such as a ceiling). The GM determines which surfaces can be climbed or crawled across.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.JqrTrvwV7pYStMXz]{Spell Effect: Levitate}

spell->Mind Reading.name: Mind Reading
spell->Mind Reading.description:
With a cursory mental touch, you attempt to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your mind reading for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target perceives vague surface thoughts from you when you Cast the Spell.

Success You find out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Failure You perceive vague surface thoughts from the target when you Cast the Spell, and you find out whether its Intelligence is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Critical Failure As failure, and for the duration of the spell, you can Sustain the spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

spell->Daze.name: Daze
spell->Daze.description:
You push into the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals 1d6 mental damage, with a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]{Invisibility Potion}) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Telekinetic Hand.name: Telekinetic Hand
spell->Telekinetic Hand.description:
You create a floating, magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and levitates it slowly up to 20 feet in any direction. When you Sustain the spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
spell->Telekinetic Hand.target: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less

spell->Telekinetic Projectile.name: Telekinetic Projectile
spell->Telekinetic Projectile.description:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack roll against the target. If you hit, you deal 2d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage—as appropriate for the object you hurled. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.

Critical Success You deal double damage.

Success You deal full damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vJZ49cgi8szuQXAD]
Varita de descanso pacífico (rango 2)
consumable->Wand of Peaceful Rest (Rank.consumableSpellDescription:
The targeted corpse doesn't decay, nor can it be transformed into an undead. If the corpse is subject to a spell that requires the corpse to have died within a certain amount of time (for example, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG] {Raise Dead} ), do not count the duration of peaceful rest against that time. This spell also prevents ordinary bugs and pests (such as maggots) from consuming the body.

Heightened (5th) The spell's duration is unlimited, but the spell takes one more action to cast and requires a cost (embalming fluid worth 6 gp).
consumable->Wand of Peaceful Rest (Rank.description:
This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

consumable->Wand of Force Barrage (Rank.consumableSpellDescription:
Disparas un fragmento de magia solidificada hacia una criatura que puedes ver. Golpea automáticamente e inflige 1d4+1 de daño de fuerza. Por cada acción adicional que uses al lanzar el hechizo, aumenta en uno el número de fragmentos que disparas, hasta un máximo de tres fragmentos para 3 acciones. Tú eliges el objetivo para cada fragmento individualmente. Si disparas más de un fragmento al mismo objetivo, combina el daño antes de aplicar bonificaciones o penalizaciones al daño, resistencias, debilidades, etc.

Intensificado (+2) Disparas un fragmento adicional con cada acción que gastas.

Tu mente se vuelve clara y la cognición fluye libremente, pero los asuntos físicos parecen efímeros.

Beneficio Obtienes un bono +2 de elemento a las pruebas de Arcanos, Artesanía, Saber, Ocultismo y Sociedad y todas las pruebas a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} . tu criticolas fallas en las comprobaciones @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} se convierten en fallas.

Inconveniente Recibes un penalizador -2 a las tiradas de ataque con y sin armas, pruebas de Atletismo y pruebas de acrobacia. Puedes llevar 2 de Volumen menos de lo normal antes de quedar gravado, y el Volumen máximo que puedes llevar se reduce en 4.

Duración 10 minutos.

Como es habitual al estar oculto cuando tu posición aún es obvia, no puedes usar este ocultamiento para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.
