Critical Failure As failure, but the target can't attempt a save to end the fascination if it disagrees with you.

spell->Locate (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LQzlKbYjZSMFQawP]
Localizar (a voluntad)
spell->Locate (At Will).description:
You learn the direction to the target (if you picked a specific object, such as "my mother's sword") or the nearest target (if you picked a type of object, such as "swords"). If the target is a specific object, you must have observed it directly with your own senses. If it's a type of object, you still need to have an accurate mental image of the type of object. If there's lead or running water between you and the target, this spell can't locate the object. This means you might find a type of object farther away if the nearest one is behind lead or running water.

Heightened (5th) You can target a specific creature or ancestry instead of an object, but you must have met or seen up close the creature or ancestry you want to target.
spell->Locate (At Will).target: 1 specific object or type of object

spell->Mind Reading (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC]
Lectura de la mente (a voluntad)
spell->Mind Reading (At Will).description:
With a cursory mental touch, you attempt to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your mind reading for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target perceives vague surface thoughts from you when you Cast the Spell.

Success You find out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Failure You perceive vague surface thoughts from the target when you Cast the Spell, and you find out whether its Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Critical Failure As failure, and for the duration of the spell, you can Sustain the Spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

spell->Inveigle.name: Inveigle
spell->Inveigle.cost: rare oils worth a total value of 10 gp × the target's level
spell->Inveigle.description:
You win over the target's mind, causing it to see you as a close and trusted friend and look upon your every suggestion as reasonable. The target is helpful toward you, so it will go out of its way to help you. As with any other helpful creature, there are limits to what you can ask of it. If you ever ask the target to do something completely against its nature or needlessly harmful to the target or its interests, not only does it refuse, but it also can attempt a Will save to end the effect early. Because of the casting time and range, it's generally difficult to cast this ritual unless the target is willing (perhaps convinced the ritual will have some other effect) or restrained. If the creature is unwilling to accept the ritual, it can attempt a Will save to negate the effect.

Critical Success The ritual succeeds and the target takes a -4 status penalty to Will saves to end the effect.

Success The ritual succeeds.

Failure The ritual fails.

Critical Failure The ritual fails and the target instead hates you, becoming hostile to you for the duration.

Heightened (6th) You can use inveigle on a creature up to 1 mile away throughout the casting, as long as you have a lock of hair, a drop of blood, or some other piece of the creature's body, which you mix into the oils used in the cost. The base cost increases to 100 gp. The duration is shorter than normal, based on how large a piece of the creature's body you use. Blood, hair, scales, and the like cause the ritual to last 1 week, while a hand or other substantial body part causes the ritual to last 1 month.
spell->Inveigle.target: 1 criatura de un nivel no mayor que el doble del nivel del ritual de insinuación

spell->Silence.name: Silence
spell->Silence.description:
The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.mmJNE57hC7G3SPae]{Spell Effect: Silence}

Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10- foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Infernal Pact.name: Infernal Pact
spell->Infernal Pact.description:
You make an appeal to a powerful devil, asking it to bind some of its subordinates to your service. If you succeed, the devil sends you its choice of one devil whose level is no more than double infernal pact's rank, two devils whose levels are each at least 2 less than double the spell rank, or three devils whose levels are each at least 3 less than double the spell rank.

Critical Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #weeks]]{1d4 weeks}.

Success The devils are sent to you and serve you for [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}.

Failure Your request is denied.

Critical Failure Not only is your request denied, but the powerful devil sends word of its displeasure to your master.
spell->Infernal Pact.primarycheck: Religion (expert; you must be a devil)

action->Telepathy 100 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]
Telepatía 100 pies

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Distracting Declaration.name: Declaración que distrae
action->Distracting Declaration.description: Urevian mantiene algunas palabras astutas listas para distraer a los enemigos. Siempre utiliza el engaño para tomar la iniciativa.

action->Ward Contract.name: Contrato de barrio
action->Ward Contract.description: Cualquier contrato firmado que Urevian lleve (incluido cualquiera que cubra sus cuernos) es inmune al daño de criaturas distintas de Urevian. Además, Urevian es inmune a los efectos mentales que le harían alterar, anular o destruir un contrato.

action->Draft Contract.name: Proyecto de contrato
action->Draft Contract.description:
Ureviano produce un contrato infernal para un solo mortal vivo. Este contrato puede otorgar una amplia gama de habilidades y efectos, similar al poder de un hechizo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} pero cumplido al pie de la letra por Urevian. Para recibir cualquiera de esos beneficios, el mortal debe firmar voluntariamente su verdadero nombre en el contrato. En ese momento, el alma del mortal está ligada a Urevia y al Infierno.

Mientras el contrato esté vigente, el mortal no puede recuperar la vida.excepto por deseo o magia similar. Si el mortal vuelve a la vida por esos medios, Urevian sabe qué mortal volvió a la vida y puede localizar la criatura o criaturas que le devolvieron la vida durante 1 año, obteniendo los efectos de un hechizo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LQzlKbYjZSMFQawP]{Locate} con alcance ilimitado. Evitar los términos de un contrato infernal es difícil y, a menudo, peligroso.

action->Infernal Wound.name: Herida infernal
action->Infernal Wound.description:
Los ataques de Urevian también causan @Damage[2d6[bleed]] que resiste los intentos de curarlos.

El cheque plano para detener el sangrado comienza en @Check[type:flat|dc:20] . La CD se reduce a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] sólo si la criatura sangrante o un aliado ayuda con éxito con la recuperación. La CD para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} a una criatura con una herida infernal se incrementa en 5.

Un lanzador de conjuros o un objeto que intenta usar magia curativa en una criatura que sufre unaLa herida infernal debe tener éxito en una prueba de contraataque CD 28 o la magia no podrá curar a la criatura.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.inLBsuLRE5xmVHdn]{Effect: Infernal Wound}

action->Right of Inspection.name: Derecho de inspección
action->Right of Inspection.description: Urevian puede lanzar su hechizo innato @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying} a voluntad, pero sólo para apuntar a una criatura con la que tiene un contrato, una criatura específica nombrada en un contrato que tiene, o un descendiente de cualquiera de esas criaturas. El resultado de la tirada de salvación del objetivo es un paso peor que el resultado del lanzamiento.

Urthagul.name: Urthagul
Urthagul.publicNotes:
La característica más horrible de un gug es su cabeza en forma de barril, que se divide verticalmente para revelar numerosas hileras de dientes amarillos y afilados y una garganta abierta. Sus ojos a ambos lados de la mandíbula son pequeños pero penetrantes. Las crestas óseas protegen sus ojos de los frenéticos movimientos de su presa, ya que prefiere comer carne cruda y retorcida a hongos y moho. Agarra a dicha presa con poderosos brazos que se dividen a la altura del codo en un par de antebrazos, dándole cuatro garras. Estos monstruosos brutos soncubierto de pelaje negro y desgreñado, a menudo cubierto de sangre y vísceras.

Aunque los gugs pueden parecer bestiales, tienen intelectos agudos y malvados. Los gugs viven muy bajo tierra, pero a veces salen a la superficie para cazar durante las noches oscuras, ya sea solos o en pequeños grupos. Como poseen apetitos voraces, la mayoría de los gugs consumen las criaturas que capturan, pero algunos en lugar de eso secuestran a sus víctimas y se esconden bajo la superficie, dejando sólo un hedor persistente y extrañas huellas de garras.Las víctimas son llevadas a guaridas rancias marcadas con extrañas runas y sacrificadas a los malvados dioses de la sangre, la oscuridad y las pesadillas de los gugs. Rumores espantosos hablan de ciudades gug sin luz hechas de titánicos bloques de piedra muy bajo tierra, donde poderosos líderes gug predican sus viles doctrinas a multitudes de gugs aulladores.

Los gugs tienen una extraña relación con los ghouls, que parece datar de su origen compartido en un lejano mundo subterráneo. Los gugs viven con miedo a los demonios, a pesar deelevándose sobre ellos; sin embargo, este extraño miedo no se aplica a los fantasmas, a quienes los gugs consumen con tanta voracidad como a otras criaturas.

Los gugs miden 16 pies de alto y pesan 2,000 libras, aunque tienen un andar misterioso y elegante que desmiente su inmenso tamaño. Su paso ligero y su capacidad para pasar por grietas muy pequeñas hacen que los gugs sean los hombres del saco comunes en las historias de desapariciones extrañas o masacres sangrientas.

Algunos gugs particularmente sedientos de sangre gananhorribles poderes como regalos de sus sobrenaturales patrocinadores. Estos monstruos son conocidos como sabios, nunca tienen menos de nivel 12 en poder y obtienen varios hechizos innatos ocultistas. Aunque la combinación precisa de hechizos de cada sabio varía, normalmente estos hechizos otorgan invisibilidad, ofrecen poder para manipular y cambiar rocas o invocar energías terribles y destructivas sobre la carne viva.

equipment->Crimson Fulcrum Lens.name: Crimson Fulcrum Lens
equipment->Crimson Fulcrum Lens.description:
This concave lens has a drifting crimson cloud resembling slowly swirling blood within it. While you have the Crimson Fulcrum Lens invested, you seethe with malevolent fury you can barely contain. You gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws against fear effects and a +2 item bonus to your melee Strike damage (this increases to a +4 item bonus to damage if the melee Strike is a jaws attack). You can also activate the lens in the following ways.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.ytqvHyF0oMKbo65P]{Effect: Crimson Fulcrum Lens}

Activate 2 Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You grasp the Crimson Fulcrum Lens in one hand and make a Strike that doesn't require that hand. The Strike deals an additional 1d8 precision damage (or 2d8 precision damage if you make a jaws Strike) and doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.

Activate 2 Interact (attack, possession)

Effect While grasping the lens, make a melee spell attack roll with a modifier of [[/r 1d20+18]]{+18}. On a hit, you force the splinter of Nhimbaloth's essence from the lens to possess the target. You're no longer invested in the lens, and the target gains the benefits as though it had invested the lens but can't activate the lens's other abilities. This effect is permanent, but it can be ended by any effect that removes a possession effect. The lens doesn't have any magical abilities until the possession effect ends; when it does, the essence returns to the lens.

effect->Effect: Crimson Fulcrum Lens.name: Effect: Crimson Fulcrum Lens
effect->Effect: Crimson Fulcrum Lens.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.yAqGhT0GuZrkvWZl]{Crimson Fulcrum Lens}

You gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws against fear effects and a +2 item bonus to your melee Strike damage (this increases to a +4 item bonus to damage if the melee Strike is a jaws attack).

action->Eerie Flexibility.name: Flexibilidad misteriosa
action->Eerie Flexibility.description: A pesar de su tamaño, las múltiples articulaciones del gug le permiten pasar por espacios reducidos como si fuera una criatura mediana. Mientras @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, puede moverse a su máxima velocidad.

action->Furious Claws.name: Garras furiosas
action->Furious Claws.description: El gug realiza hasta cuatro golpes de garra, cada uno contra un objetivo diferente. Todos estos ataques cuentan para la penalización por ataque múltiple del gug, pero la penalización no aumenta hasta que el gug realiza todos sus ataques.

action->Rend.name: Rend
action->Rend.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]

Garra

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

Vengeful Furnace.name: Horno vengativo
Vengeful Furnace.description: La escotilla encima del horno embrujado se abre y arroja un par de fantasmas ardientes y chillones.
Vengeful Furnace.disable: @Check[type:intimidation|dc:22|name:Cow a Spirit] (entrenado) para intimidar a uno de los espíritus vengativos o @Check[type:religion|dc:25|name:Exorcise the Spirit] (entrenado) para exorcizar el espíritu. La guarida permanece activa hasta que ambos espíritus sean intimidados o exorcizados, o hasta que se destruya el horno.
Vengeful Furnace.reset: La guarida se reinicia 1 hora después de que no hay criaturas en la habitación.
Vengeful Furnace.routine: (3 acciones) Los fantasmas ardientes azotan a una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado} aleatoria en la habitación (o cualquier criatura aleatoria, si ninguna criatura en la habitación está estupefacta).

action->Burn Knowledge.name: Quemar conocimiento
action->Burn Knowledge.description:
El objetivo del Asalto Fantasmal inicial de la guarida, así como cualquier criatura golpeada posteriormente por un Golpe de látigo ardiente, pierde recuerdos aleatorios, como si estos pensamientos fueran incinerados como páginas de un libro en llamas.

La criatura debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:23].

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada.

Éxito La criatura se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 1} durante 1 minuto mientras olvidan recuerdos aleatorios, como si estos pensamientos fueran incinerados como páginas de un libro en llamas.

Fracaso Como éxito, pero la condición de estupefacción 1 persiste durante 24 horas.

Fallo crítico Como fallo, pero @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 2} .

action->Ghostly Assault.name: Asalto fantasmal
action->Ghostly Assault.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura viviente con una puntuación de Inteligencia de 15 o más entra a la habitación, o cualquier criatura toca el horno

Efecto Fantasmas ardientes brotan del horno, exponiendo a la criatura desencadenante al efecto de conocimiento de quemadura del refugio. La iniciativa de los rollos de caza.

spell->Darkness.name: Darkness
spell->Darkness.description:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

spell->Death Knell.name: Death Knell
spell->Death Knell.description:
You snuff the life out of a creature on the brink of death. The target must attempt a Will save. If this kills it, you gain 10 temporary HP and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} value increases by 1.

Failure The target dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.98XT2QUk6wvXIqf7]{Spell Effect: Death Knell}

spell->Fear.name: Fear
spell->Fear.description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

spell->Feather Fall (At Will) (Self Only.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TTwOKGqmZeKSyNMH]
Caída de plumas (a voluntad) (solo para uno mismo)
spell->Feather Fall (At Will) (Self Only.description:
Trigger a creature within range is falling

You cause the air itself to arrest a fall. The target's fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating falling damage. If the target reaches the ground while the spell is in effect, it takes no damage from the fall. The spell ends as soon as the target lands.

spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]
Rayo de debilitamiento
spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

action->Necrotic Decay.name: Decaimiento necrótico
action->Necrotic Decay.description: Cuando Vischari muere, su carne invisible se pudre y se sublima en un gas maloliente que llena un @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] alrededor de su cuerpo. Este gas causa @Damage[7d6[void]] daño a las criaturas en esta área mientras su carne se cuaja y se pudre (salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|basic:true]).

action->Immobilizing Blow.name: Golpe inmovilizador
action->Immobilizing Blow.description:
Vischari lanza un puñetazo que desactiva el control motor de su objetivo. El objetivo debe realizar una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]. Si el Golpe fue un golpe crítico, trata el resultado de salvación del objetivo como un grado peor. Luego, el objetivo queda temporalmente inmune durante 1 hora.

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Aturdido 1} .

Fallo El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizado} durante 1 ronda.

Fallo crítico El objetivo queda paralizado durante 1 minuto. Al final de cada uno de sus turnos, puede intentar una nueva salvación de Fortaleza para reducir la duración restante en 1 ronda o finalizarla por completo con un éxito crítico.

action->Wicked Bite.name: Mordedura malvada
action->Wicked Bite.description:
Requisitos Vischari dañó a una criatura con un golpe de mandíbulas en su última acción

Efecto Vischari mantiene el contacto, volviendo la carne de la criatura translúcida alrededor del sitio de la herida. Vischari elige una de dos opciones, cada una de las cuales requiere que el objetivo intente una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]. Si el golpe de sus mandíbulas fue un golpe crítico, la criatura sufre ambos efectos, usando el mismo resultado de salvación paraambos.

  • Drenar sangre Vischari bebe un poco de la sangre de la criatura. En una salvación fallida, la criatura es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1} y ​​Vischari recupera [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 HP} (en un fallo crítico, es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 2} y ​​Vischari recupera [[/r 20[healing]]]{20 HP} ).
  • Drenar vitalidad Vischari extrae parte de la esencia vital de la criatura. La criatura se convierte@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 1} durante 1 hora en caso de un error de guardado (o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 2} durante 1 hora en caso de un error crítico).

Viscous Black Pudding.name: Morcilla Viscosa
Viscous Black Pudding.publicNotes:
Estos exudados, que se encuentran con mayor frecuencia bajo tierra, recorren las cuevas en busca de objetos que se disuelvan con sus secreciones corrosivas. Este ácido cáustico es particularmente peligroso para las criaturas que atacan un pudín, ya que puede dañar y destruir rápidamente el equipo.

Se pueden encontrar limos, moho y otros exudados en mazmorras húmedas y bosques sombreados. Si bien no son necesariamente malvados, algunos crecen hasta alcanzar tamaños enormes y tienen apetitos insaciables.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Sensor de movimiento 60 pies
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: Una morcilla puede sentir el movimiento cercano a través de la vibración y el movimiento del aire.

action->Adjust Shape.name: Ajustar forma
action->Adjust Shape.description: Una morcilla viscosa es más espesa que la mayoría de las morcillas y puede amontonarse sobre sí misma o extenderse nuevamente. El pudín cambia de tamaño a Mediano, Grande o Enorme. Si el pudín es Medio, su densidad reduce su Velocidad a 10 pies, pero esta habilidad no cambia sus Golpes ni su Velocidad. Si la morcilla viscosa se parte, las dos morcillas nuevas tendrán el mismo tamaño que tenía en ese momento, hasta que ajusten su forma.

action->Corrosive Mass.name: Masa corrosiva
action->Corrosive Mass.description: Una criatura que golpea el pudín con un arma de metal o madera debe tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:reflex|dc:22] o el arma sufre @Damage[2d6[acid]] daño (después de infligir daño a la morcilla como de costumbre). Las armas arrojadizas y las municiones reciben este daño automáticamente sin salvación.

action->Split.name: Dividir
action->Split.description:
Cuando la morcilla es golpeada por un ataque que causaría daño cortante o perforante y tiene 10 o más HP, se divide en dos pudines idénticos, cada uno con la mitad de HP del original.

Un pudín está en el mismo espacio que el original y el otro aparece en un espacio adyacente desocupado. Si no hay ningún espacio adyacente desocupado, automáticamente empuja a las criaturas y objetos fuera del camino para llenar un espacio (el DJ decide si un objeto o criatura es demasiado grande o resistente).para empujar).

action->Constrict.name: Constrict
action->Constrict.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(1d8+7)[bludgeoning] ,1d6[ácido]]{1d8+7 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 acid damage} , @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true] guardar

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Corrosive Touch.name: Toque corrosivo
action->Corrosive Touch.description: Cuando el pudín golpea a una criatura con su pseudópodo, cualquier daño por ácido se inflige a la armadura o ropa de la criatura, así como a la criatura.

action->Suction.name: Succión
action->Suction.description: El pudín puede trepar por los techos y otras superficies invertidas, aunque dichas superficies son un terreno difícil para él.

action->Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense (Impreciso) 30 pies

action->Constrict (Grabbed by Claws only.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]
Constrict (agarrado solo por garras)
action->Constrict (Grabbed by Claws only.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(1d8+12)[bludgeoning]] daño, CD 28

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Draining Venom.name: Veneno drenante
action->Draining Venom.description:
Tiro de salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Duración máxima 6 rondas

Etapa 1 drenado 1 (1 ronda)

Etapa 2 drenado 2 (1 ronda)

action->Mind Feeding.name: Alimentación mental
action->Mind Feeding.description:
Requisitos Una criatura drenada es agarrada por los tentáculos del chuul

Efecto La criatura sufre @Damage[3d6[mental]] daño.

action->Swamp Stride.name: Paso del pantano
action->Swamp Stride.description: El chuul Voidbracken ignora el terreno difícil y el terreno aún más difícil en los pantanos.

action->Tentacle Transfer.name: Transferencia de tentáculo
action->Tentacle Transfer.description:
Requisitos El chuul Voidbracken tiene una criatura agarrada

Efecto El chuul transfiere la criatura agarrada de sus garras a sus tentáculos, o viceversa. La criatura queda expuesta al veneno drenante del chuul cuando se transfiere a los tentáculos y al comienzo de cada uno de los giros del chuul si permanece agarrado por los tentáculos.

Voidglutton.name: glotón vacío
Voidglutton.publicNotes: Un glotón del vacío es un poderoso tipo de fuego fatuo que acecha en un lugar donde habita la miseria, como un cementerio, un campo de prisioneros o un campo de batalla reciente. Un glotón vacío aparece como una esfera hirviente de ojos brillantes que giran alrededor de un vórtice negro vacío de 4 pies de ancho. Desde el interior de este vórtice se extienden zarcillos largos y semitransparentes que terminan en manos puntiagudas de siete dedos.

spell->Darkness (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]
Oscuridad (a voluntad)
spell->Darkness (At Will).description:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

action->Glow.name: Brillo
action->Glow.description: 30 pies. Las puntas de los dedos de un glotón del vacío y sus siete ojos brillan, proyectando una luz brillante en el área y haciéndola visible si fuera @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} .

action->Consume Light.name: Consumir luz
action->Consume Light.description:
Desencadenante El voidglutton lanza @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness}

Efecto El glotón del vacío extingue su resplandor como parte del lanzamiento del hechizo. Se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} mientras permanezca en el área de oscuridad. Si el glotón del vacío utiliza una acción hostil, su invisibilidad termina tan pronto como se completa la acción hostil.

action->Ectoplasmic Web Trap.name: Trampa de red ectoplasmática
action->Ectoplasmic Web Trap.description: Una criatura golpeada por la trampa de red ectoplasmática del glotón del vacío es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizado} y ​​queda pegada a la superficie más cercana hasta que supera una prueba de CD 26 para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. La trampa de red ectoplasmática puede inmovilizar criaturas incorpóreas.

action->Fearful Strike.name: Golpe aterrador
action->Fearful Strike.description: Cuando el voidglotton daña a una criatura con su Golpe de garra, la criatura debe tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:26] o convertirse en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 1} ( @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 2} en un fallo crítico).

action->Feed on Fear.name: Alimentarse del miedo
action->Feed on Fear.description:
Frecuencia una vez por ronda

Requisito Un enemigo está afectado por un efecto de miedo o tiene la condición de asustado o moribundo, y se encuentra a 25 pies del voidglotton

Efecto El glotón del vacío se alimenta del terror de la criatura. Recupera [[/r 3d4[healing]]] Puntos de Vida y su Brillo se reaviva si se hubiera extinguido.

No puedeusa Consumir Luz nuevamente para [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Consume Light]]{1d4 rounds} , ya que está demasiado saturado de miedo para suprimir su Resplandor.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Inmunidad mágica
action->Magic Immunity.description: Un Voidglotton es inmune a todos los hechizos excepto @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary} y ​​hechizos con el rasgo de luz.

spell->Dimension Door.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Puerta de dimensión
spell->Dimension Door.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

spell->Suggestion.name: Suggestion
spell->Suggestion.description:
Your honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. You suggest a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self-destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and knows you tried to control it.

Success The target is unaffected and thinks you were talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

Failure The target immediately follows your suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

Critical Failure As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Bind Undead.name: Bind Undead
spell->Bind Undead.description:
With a word of power, you seize control of the target. It gains the minion trait. If you or an ally uses any hostile actions against the target, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.rVkUzqS4rpZp9LS3]{Spell Effect: Bind Undead}
spell->Bind Undead.target: 1 mindless undead creature with a level no greater than bind undead's spell rank

spell->Mind Reading.name: Mind Reading
spell->Mind Reading.description:
With a cursory mental touch, you attempt to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your mind reading for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target perceives vague surface thoughts from you when you Cast the Spell.

Success You find out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Failure You perceive vague surface thoughts from the target when you Cast the Spell, and you find out whether its Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Critical Failure As failure, and for the duration of the spell, you can Sustain the Spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

spell->Paralyze.name: Paralyze
spell->Paralyze.description:
You block the target's motor impulses before they can leave its mind, threatening to freeze the target in place. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is Paralyzed for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Animate Object.name: Animate Object
spell->Animate Object.description:
You transform the target into an animated object with a level up to that allowed by Table 7-1 and of a type corresponding to the object (so a broom would become an animated broom).

Table 7-1: Creatures Creation Rituals

Creature Level Spell Rank Required Cost
-1 or 0 2 15 gp
1 2 60 gp
2 3 105 gp
3 3 180 gp
4 4 300 gp
5 4 480 gp
6 5 750 gp
7 5 1,080 gp
8 6 1,500 gp
9 6 2,100 gp
10 7 3,000 gp
11 7 4,200 gp
12 8 6,000 gp
13 8 9,000 gp
14 9 13,500 gp
15 9 19,500 gp
16 10 30,000 gp
17 10 45,000 gp

Critical Success The target becomes an animated object of the appropriate type. If it's at least 4 levels lower than you, you can make it a minion. This gives it the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you command it, and commanding it is a single action that has the auditory and concentrate traits. You can have a maximum of four minions under your control. If it doesn't become a minion, you can give it one simple command. It pursues that goal single-mindedly, ignoring any of your subsequent commands.

Success As critical success, except an animated object that doesn't become your minion stays in place and attacks anyone that attacks it or tries to steal or move it, rather than following your command.

Failure You fail to create the animated object.

Critical Failure You create the animated object, but it goes berserk and attempts to destroy you.

spell->Comprehend Language.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vTQvfYu2llKQedmY]
Comprender el lenguaje
spell->Comprehend Language.description:
The target can understand the meaning of a single language it is hearing or reading when you cast the spell. This doesn't let it understand codes, language couched in metaphor, and the like (subject to GM discretion). If the target can hear multiple languages and knows that, it can choose which language to understand; otherwise, choose one of the languages randomly.

Heightened (3rd) The target can also speak the language.

Heightened (4th) You can target up to 10 creatures, and targets can also speak the language.

spell->Create Undead.name: Create Undead
spell->Create Undead.description:
You transform the target into an undead creature with a level up to that allowed in Table 7-1. There are many versions of this ritual, each specific to a particular type of undead (one ritual for all zombies, one for skeletons, one for ghouls, and so on), and the rituals that create rare undead are also rare. Some forms of undead, such as liches, form using their own unique methods and can't be created with a version of create undead.

Table 7-1: Creatures Creation Rituals

Creature Level Spell Rank Required Cost
-1 or 0 2 15 gp
1 2 60 gp
2 3 105 gp
3 3 180 gp
4 4 300 gp
5 4 480 gp
6 5 750 gp
7 5 1,080 gp
8 6 1,500 gp
9 6 2,100 gp
10 7 3,000 gp
11 7 4,200 gp
12 8 6,000 gp
13 8 9,000 gp
14 9 13,500 gp
15 9 19,500 gp
16 10 30,000 gp
17 10 45,000 gp

Critical Success The target becomes an undead creature of the appropriate type. If it's at least 4 levels lower than you, you can make it a minion. This gives it the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you command it, and commanding it is a single action that has the auditory and concentrate traits. You can have a maximum of four minions under your control. If it's intelligent and doesn't become a minion, the undead is helpful to you for awakening it, though it's still a horrid and evil creature. If it's unintelligent and doesn't become a minion, you can give it one simple command. It pursues that goal single-mindedly, ignoring any of your subsequent commands.

Success As critical success, except an intelligent undead that doesn't become your minion is only friendly to you, and an unintelligent undead that doesn't become your minion leaves you alone unless you attack it. It marauds the local area rather than following your command.

Failure You fail to create the undead.

Critical Failure You create the undead, but its soul, tortured by your foul necromancy, is full of nothing but hatred for you. It attempts to destroy you.

spell->Darkness (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]
Oscuridad (a voluntad)
spell->Darkness (At Will).description:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

spell->Faerie Fire (At Will).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]
Fuego de hadas (a voluntad)
spell->Faerie Fire (At Will).description: All creatures in the area when you cast the spell are limned in colorful, heatless fire of a color of your choice for the duration. Visible creatures can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire. If the creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, they are Concealed while affected by faerie fire, rather than being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}.

spell->Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
spell->Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory images of you swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on [[/r 1d4]]). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1-2 on [[/r 1d6]]). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1-3 on [[/r 1d6]]).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.0PO5mFRhh9HxGAtv]{Spell Effect: Mirror Image}

spell->Vomit Swarm.name: Vomit Swarm
spell->Vomit Swarm.description:
You belch forth a swarm of magical vermin. You evoke and shape the creatures from your own imagination, allowing you to change the appearance of the creatures (typically a mix of centipedes, roaches, wasps, and worms), but this doesn't change the effect of the spell. The vermin swarm over anyone in the area, their bites and stings dealing @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its saving throw also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Once the spell ends, the swarm disappears.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by @Damage[1d8[piercing]].

spell->Worm's Repast.name: Worm's Repast
spell->Worm's Repast.description:
Gnawing worms materialize within the flesh of the target creature, dealing 4d6 piercing damage and @Damage[floor(@item.level/2)d6[persistent,piercing]] damage. If the target is a non-skeletal corporeal undead creature, you deal an extra @Damage[floor((@item.level/2)+1)d6[persistent,piercing]] damage. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The worms writhe away harmlessly and the target takes no damage.

Success The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately.

Failure The target takes full initial and persistent damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} due to the pain for as long as it takes persistent damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target takes double the initial damage and is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} by the pain for as long as it takes persistent damage.

Heightened (+2) The initial and persistent damage increase by 2d6 and 1d6, respectively

spell->Alarm.name: Alarm
spell->Alarm.description:
You ward an area to alert you when creatures enter without your permission. When you cast alarm, select a password. Whenever a Small or larger corporeal creature enters the spell's area without speaking the password, alarm sends your choice of a mental alert (in which case the spell gains the mental trait) or an audible alarm with the sound and volume of a hand bell (in which case the spell gains the auditory trait). Either option automatically awakens you, and the bell allows each creature in the area to attempt a DC 15 Perception check to wake up. A creature aware of the alarm must succeed at a Stealth check against the spell's DC or trigger the spell when moving into the area.

Heightened (3rd) You can specify criteria for which creatures sound the alarm spell-for instance, orcs or masked people.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Luces danzantes
spell->Dancing Lights.description: Creas hasta cuatro luces flotantes, ninguna de las cuales está a más de 10 pies de distancia. Cada uno arroja luz como una antorcha. Cuando sostienes el hechizo, puedes mover cualquier cantidad de luces hasta 60 pies. Cada luz debe permanecer a 120 pies de usted y a 10 pies de todas las demás, o parpadeará.

spell->Daze.name: Daze
spell->Daze.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Grim Tendrils.name: Grim Tendrils
spell->Grim Tendrils.description:
Tendrils of darkness curl out from your fingertips and race through the air. You deal 2d4 void damage and @Damage[(@item.level)[bleed]] damage to living creatures in the line. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half the void damage and no persistent bleed damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double void damage and double persistent bleed damage.

Heightened (+1) The void damage increases by 2d4, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

spell->Illusory Disguise.name: Illusory Disguise
spell->Illusory Disguise.description:
You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{Impersonate} use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

Heightened (2nd) The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (3rd) You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{Spell Effect: Illusory Disguise}

spell->Light.name: Light
spell->Light.description:
The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.cVVZXNbV0nElVOPZ]{Spell Effect: Light}

Heightened (4th) The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).
spell->Light.target: 1 objeto de 1 volumen o menos, ya sea desatendido o poseído por ti o por un aliado dispuesto

spell->Mage Hand.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mano de mago
spell->Mage Hand.description:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
spell->Mage Hand.target: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less

spell->Mindlink.name: Mindlink
spell->Mindlink.description: You link your mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

spell->Phantom Pain.name: Phantom Pain
spell->Phantom Pain.description:
Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and 1d4 persistent mental damage. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately.

Failure The target takes full initial and persistent damage, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. If the target recovers from being Sickened, the persistent damage ends and the spell ends.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4 and the persistent damage by 1d4.

@Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,mental]]{Scaling Persistent Mental Damage}

spell->Read Aura.name: Read Aura
spell->Read Aura.description:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

spell->Unseen Servant.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xqmHD8JIjak15lRk]
Sirviente invisible
spell->Unseen Servant.description:
You summon an unseen servant, which you can command as part of Sustaining the Spell. It serves you until its Hit Points are reduced to 0, at which point the spell ends, or until you stop Sustaining the Spell. The unseen servant gains the summoned trait.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.j7NNPfZwD19BwSEZ]{Unseen Servant} (No Alignment)

action->Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense (Impreciso) 30 pies

action->Fast Healing 7.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]
Curación Rápida 7

action->Discorporate.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QlrbnkeZu6M4kvOy]
Descorporar
action->Discorporate.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QlrbnkeZu6M4kvOy]

Las sanguijuelas de movimiento lento dan a los héroes 2 rondas, en lugar de 1 ronda, para despachar a las alimañas que huyen antes de que escapen.

Cuando el gusano que camina se reduce a 0 HP, se descorpora y los gusanos que componen su cuerpo se dispersan en todas direcciones. Si se escapa incluso un solo gusano, el gusano que camina eventualmente se volverá a formar mediante un proceso que normalmente toma[[/br 1d10 #Re-Form]]{1d10 days} .

Si bien las circunstancias y el entorno exactos determinan cuánto tiempo tienen los enemigos del gusano que camina para despachar a los gusanos que huyen antes de que escapen, por lo general sus enemigos solo tienen una ronda.

Normalmente, esto requiere la aplicación de un efecto de área o arma de salpicadura dentro de 1 ronda en el espacio donde colapsó el gusano que camina. Después de que se inflige cualquier cantidad de daño de área o de salpicadura a ese espacio, el personaje que infligeel daño debe intentar una verificación @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. Cada área posterior o efecto de daño por salpicadura realizado en el área reduce la CD de esta prueba plana en 2, hasta un mínimo de CD 5. Si cualquiera de estas pruebas planas tiene éxito, ninguno de los gusanos escapa y el gusano que camina es destruido permanentemente. .

A discreción del DJ, medios inteligentes para atrapar o detener de otro modo a las alimañas pueden extender el tiempo permitido para acabar con el gusano que camina.

action->Hateful Memories.name: Recuerdos odiosos
action->Hateful Memories.description: Si Volluk puede ver una representación precisa de su apariencia anterior como un drow viviente al comienzo de su turno, debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:28] o se llenará de autodesprecio y se convertirá en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} durante 1 ronda.

action->Squirming Embrace.name: Abrazo retorcido
action->Squirming Embrace.description: Volluk da zancadas, finaliza su movimiento compartiendo un espacio con una criatura y le causa @Damage[3d8[piercing]] daño a la criatura. La criatura puede intentar una salvación @Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true].

action->Swarm Shape.name: Forma de enjambre
action->Swarm Shape.description: Volluk colapsa en un enjambre informe de sanguijuelas. Deja caer todos los artículos retenidos, usados ​​y transportados. Mientras está descorporado, no puede usar acciones de ataque ni lanzar hechizos, pero puede moverse a través de áreas lo suficientemente pequeñas como para que quepan sus sanguijuelas individuales sin tener que @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} . Puede usar la misma acción para volver a su forma normal.

Warped Brew Morlock.name: Morlock de brebaje deformado
Warped Brew Morlock.publicNotes:
Originarios de humanos perdidos hace mucho tiempo del mundo de la luz, los morlocks son monstruos brutales que habitan en los enredados túneles de los confines superiores de las Tierras Oscuras. Sus cuerpos nervudos enmascaran la fuerza de sus extremidades y sus rápidas reacciones, y sus brazos son lo suficientemente largos como para que puedan arrastrarse en un extraño movimiento de cuatro extremidades en busca de velocidad o sigilo. Ya no recuerdan las vidas que llevaron sus antepasados ​​en la superficie, aunque muchos morlocks todavía habitan en las ruinas destrozadas de sucasas antiguas. Algunos morlocks adoran las estatuas de humanos de estas épocas pasadas como dioses, pero otros ahora adoran a Lamashtu, Rovagug u otras deidades violentas.

Los jóvenes Morlock son insaciables y claman incluso por el más mínimo bocado de comida, incluso consumiendo a sus hermanos si no se les presenta otra comida. La mayoría de los morlocks fomentan la práctica para garantizar que su grupo ancestral en su conjunto se fortalezca.

Un morlock típico mide poco más de 5 pies de alto ypesa aproximadamente 150 libras.
Warped Brew Morlock.saveDetails: +2 de estado a todas las salvaciones contra enfermedades y venenos.

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disea.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+2 de estado a todas las salvaciones frente a enfermedades y venenos

action->Instinctual Tinker.name: Tinker instintivo
action->Instinctual Tinker.description:
El morlock juguetea con una construcción adyacente o un peligro mecánico. Intentan una prueba @Check[type:crafting|defense:fortitude] contra la CD de Fortaleza del constructo o peligro. El morlock no puede tener éxito si el nivel del objetivo es más del doble que el del morlock.

Éxito crítico El objetivo gana [[/r 4d6[healing]]] Puntos de vida y un bono de circunstancia +1 a las tiradas de ataque durante 1 minuto.

Éxito Elel objetivo gana [[/r 2d6[healing]]] Puntos de vida.

Fallo crítico El morlock se lastima a sí mismo, recibiendo [[/r 2d6]]{2d6 damage} (normalmente contundente, perforante o cortante, pero potencialmente de un tipo diferente a discreción del DJ).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TEzLEXBZzNCp6flg]{Effect: Instinctual Tinker (Critical Success)}

action->Leap Attack.name: Ataque de salto
action->Leap Attack.description:
El morlock Da zancadas hasta el doble de su Velocidad, durante las cuales intenta un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} o un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. En cualquier momento durante su movimiento, el morlock puede realizar un ataque cuerpo a cuerpo contra un enemigo a su alcance.

El morlock entonces no puede usar Ataque de Salto durante 1 asalto.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Los golpes de un morlock infligen 1d6 de daño de precisión adicional a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} criaturas.

action->Swarming Stance.name: Postura de enjambre
action->Swarming Stance.description: Un morlock puede compartir el mismo espacio que otro morlock, pero no más de dos morlocks pueden ocupar el mismo espacio. Cuando los morlocks comparten el mismo espacio, obtienen una bonificación de circunstancia +1 a las tiradas de ataque.

Watching Wall.name: Mirando la pared
Watching Wall.description: Una sensación abrumadora de ser observado surge en las mentes de aquellos en la habitación, un instante antes de que un misterioso ojo rojo se abra en la pared occidental.
Watching Wall.disable: @Check[type:deception|dc:22|name:Appear Uninteresting|traits:haunt] (entrenado) para parecer poco interesante al ojo observador (y por lo tanto ser ignorado por él) o @Check[type:religion|dc:22|name:Ward Against Being Seen|traits:haunt] (entrenado) para evitar ser visto o afectado por el ojo.
Watching Wall.reset: La guarida se vuelve inerte al final de cualquier ronda en la que no hay @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado} criaturas que pueda ver. Permanece inactivo durante 1 hora, después de lo cual se reinicia.
Watching Wall.routine:
(1 acción) El ojo mira a su alrededor, y aquellos que puede ver (ya sea en el área C4 o fuera de ella) reciben @Damage[4d6[mental]] daño (@Check[type:will|dc:21|basic:true|traits:haunt] salvación) mientras el miedo a ser observado imparte oleadas de dolor.

Una criatura que recibe daño mental por este efecto no reduce su valor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado} al final de su siguiente turno.

action->Someone is Watching.name: Alguien está mirando
action->Someone is Watching.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura viviente permanece en el área C4 durante al menos 1 ronda

Efecto Una ola abrumadora de paranoia llena el área C4 . Cada criatura en la habitación debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:25], con los siguientes resultados. Luego se abre un misterioso ojo rojo en el centro de la pared occidental, mirando alrededor de la habitación, y el fantasma toma la iniciativa.

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada.

Éxito La criatura se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 1} y ​​siente que alguien o algo la está observando mientras permanece asustada.

Fracaso La criatura se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 2} y ​​no trata a nadie como un aliado mientras permanezcan asustados.

Fallo crítico La criatura se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 3} y ​​es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confuso} mientras permanezca asustada.

Will-o'-the-Deep.name: Voluntad de las profundidades
Will-o'-the-Deep.publicNotes:
Malévolas bolas de luz de colores y fuegos fatuos acechan en pantanos y bosques solitarios donde atraen a los viajeros desprevenidos al peligro. Los fuegos fatuos pueden variar el color y la iluminación que arrojan, y se deleitan imitando linternas oscilantes o fuegos distantes para sacar a los viajeros perdidos o desorientados de los senderos seguros. Pueden apagar su iluminación por completo para volverse invisibles, y disfrutan haciéndolo una vez que sus víctimas están completamente perdidas y se han dado cuenta de que la luz oscilante en elDe hecho, la distancia no los lleva a un lugar seguro. Sin embargo, incluso siendo invisible, un fuego fatuo rara vez se aventura lejos de su objetivo, ya que se alimenta del pánico y el temor que sienten sus víctimas.

Debajo de su brillo, el cuerpo de un fuego fatuo es una bola esponjosa de aproximadamente 1 pie de diámetro y que pesa menos de 5 libras. Aunque la mayoría de los fuegos fatuos son meramente orbes translúcidos y sin rasgos distintivos, que se definen sólo en la iluminación cambiante que crean, algunos tienen moteados oscuros quehace que parezcan una calavera cuando se miran de cerca. Los fuegos fatuos no necesitan alimento mundano y, de hecho, carecen de la capacidad de consumir materia de cualquier tipo; encuentran todo el sustento que necesitan en el terror de las criaturas cercanas. Por este motivo, les gusta trabajar junto a muertos vivientes que producen terror en sus víctimas. Los fuegos fatuos son longevos, si no efectivamente inmortales, y tienen buena memoria. Sin embargo, un fuego fatuo intimidado o derrotado puede ser una buena fuente de conocimientos e información.Conseguir tal cooperación de un monstruo tan siniestro no es tarea fácil.

Los fuegos fatuos habitan en pantanos y bosques desolados y generalmente están activos al atardecer y al anochecer. Por lo tanto, son reacios a llevar a las víctimas a áreas inmediatamente fatales, como zonas muertas, sino que prefieren peligros donde sus víctimas sufren durante mucho tiempo, como bolsas de aire viciado o venenoso, parches de arenas movedizas y guaridas de monstruos más grandes. Según los fuegos fatuos, diferentesLos tipos de miedo tienen diferencias sutiles en sabor. El temor acechante en la boca del estómago que roe a aquellos que lentamente se dan cuenta del hecho de que están perdidos produce un sabor muy diferente al repentino y crudo terror de la muerte inminente frente a un monstruo imponente. Debido a esto, los fuegos fatuos intentan variar las formas en que inducen terror en sus presas, para asegurarse de que no se cansen de ciertos sabores de miedo.

Fuegos fatuos acuáticos,Los voluntades de las profundidades habitan en los océanos e incluso en los lagos terrestres, y cadenas de ellas pueden crear vistas profundamente hermosas. Su propensión a atraer barcos hacia arrecifes y remolinos o a invadir embarcaciones más pequeñas los convierte en un peligro mortal.

action->Glow.name: Brillo
action->Glow.description: 20 pies. Un fuego fatuo es naturalmente invisible, pero brilla con una luz de color, proyectando una luz brillante en el aura y haciéndola visible.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Inmunidad mágica
action->Magic Immunity.description: Un fuego fatuo es inmune a todos los hechizos excepto @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} y ​​@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}.

action->Aquatic Ambush.name: Aquatic Ambush
action->Aquatic Ambush.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.HBrBrUzjfvj2gDXB]

60 pies

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AquaticAmbush]

action->Feed on Fear.name: Alimentarse del miedo
action->Feed on Fear.description:
Requisito Un enemigo está bajo un efecto de miedo o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Moribundo} dentro de 15 pies del fuego fatuo.

Efecto El fuego fatuo se alimenta del terror de la criatura. Recupera [[/r 2d4[healing]]] puntos de vida y, si se ha oscurecido, su brillo se vuelve a encender.

Un fuego fatuo puede realizar esta acción sólo una vez por ronda.

action->Go Dark.name: Ir a la oscuridad
action->Go Dark.description: El fuego fatuo apaga su brillo y se vuelve invisible. Puede finalizar este efecto con otro uso de esta acción. Si usa su ataque de choque mientras es invisible, el arco de electricidad permite a cualquier observador determinar su ubicación, haciendo que el fuego fatuo solo esté oculto para todos los observadores hasta que se mueva.

Witchfire Warden.name: Guardián del fuego brujo
Witchfire Warden.publicNotes:
Manifestándose como una forma sinuosa envuelta en enfermizas llamas verdes, este no-muerto incorpóreo se forma cuando una poderosa bruja o bruja muere en agonía o rabia. El cuerpo en el centro de las llamas suele parecerse a la autoimagen idealizada de la bruja, independientemente de su edad y apariencia en el momento de su muerte.

Un fuego brujo a menudo reside en un pantano o ciénaga, que lentamente se ennegrece y se descompone a su alrededor. Estas regiones suelen estar plagadas de fuegos fatuos, que parecen haberuna extraña relación con el fuego brujo residente. Un incendio brujo puede visitar aldeas en el borde de su terreno de origen para atraer a los aldeanos, pero siempre ataca a las víctimas que estén al alcance del oído para asegurarse de que otros aldeanos escuchen los gritos. Un fuego brujo también podría aliarse con otras brujas o brujas e incluso unirse a sus aquelarres, pero un fuego brujo es incapaz de formar aquelarres completamente por sí solo.

spell->Control Weather.name: Control Weather
spell->Control Weather.description:
You alter the weather, making it calm and normal for the season or choosing up to two effects based on the season.

You can't specifically control the manifestations, such as the exact path of a tornado or the targets of lightning strikes.

  • Autumn cold weather, fog, mild heat, sleet
  • Spring drizzle, heat, hurricane, sleet, thunderstorm, tornado
  • Summer drizzle, downpour, extreme heat, hail, heat
  • Winter blizzard, mild cold, extreme cold, thaw

Critical Success You change the weather as desired and can affect a larger area (up to a 5-mile-radius circle), or a longer duration (any number of additional d12 hours, up to 16d12).

Success You change the weather as desired.

Failure You fail to change the weather as desired.

Critical Failure The weather changes in an unanticipated way, determined by the GM but generally as contradictory to your true desires as possible (for instance, a terrible storm emerges when you would prefer good weather).

Heightened (9th) You can create unseasonable weather and contradictory weather effects, such as extreme cold and a hurricane. You can make the weather calm and normal weather for a different season or choose weather effects from any season's list.

spell->Baleful Polymorph.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]
Polimorfo siniestro
spell->Baleful Polymorph.description:
You transform the target creature into a harmless animal appropriate to the area, with effects based on its Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's body gains minor features of the harmless animal. Its insides churn as they partially transform, causing it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. When it recovers from the Sickened condition, its features revert to normal.

Failure The target transforms for 1 minute but keeps its mind. If it spends all its actions on its turn concentrating on its original form, it can attempt a Will save to end the effect immediately.

Critical Failure The target is transformed into the chosen harmless animal, body and mind, for an unlimited duration.

spell->Phantasmal Calamity.name: Phantasmal Calamity
spell->Phantasmal Calamity.description:
A vision of apocalyptic destruction fills the mind of each creature in the area. The vision deals 11d6 mental damage (basic Will save). On a critical failure, the creature must also succeed at a Reflex save or believe it's trapped (stuck in a fissure, adrift at sea, or some other fate in keeping with its vision). If it fails the second save, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new Will save at the end of each of its turns, and on a success, it disbelieves the illusion and recovers from the Stunned condition.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Crushing Despair.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]
Desesperación aplastante
spell->Crushing Despair.description:
You inflict despair on creatures in the area. The effects for each creature are determined by its Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the creature can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of its turn; on a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that turn as it sobs uncontrollably.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Heightened (7th) The area increases to a 60-foot cone.

spell->Illusory Scene.name: Illusory Scene
spell->Illusory Scene.description:
You form an imaginary scene that includes up to 10 discrete creatures or objects of various sizes, all of which must be within the spell's area. These elements generate appropriate sounds and smells, and they feel right to the touch. Elements of an illusory scene are incapable of speech. Unlike with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{Illusory Creature} spell, creatures in your scene lack combat abilities and statistics. Your scene doesn't include changes to the environment around it, though you can place your scene within the illusory environment of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spell.

When you create the scene, you can choose to have it be static or follow a program. Though a static scene is stationary, it includes basic natural movement. For example, wind blowing on an illusory piece of paper would rustle it. A program can be up to 1 minute long and repeats when finished. For instance, you could create a scene of two orcs fighting each other, and the fight would go the same way for each repetition. If you create a loop, the two fighters end up in the same place at the start of the scene and at the end of it, but you can smooth the program so it's hard to tell when the loop ends and begins. Anyone observing the scene for more than a few minutes almost always notices it looping. You're unable to alter the program after you create the illusion.

Any creature that touches any part of the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion. If they interact with a portion of the illusion, they disbelieve only that portion. They disbelieve the entire scene only on a critical success.

Heightened (6th) Creatures or objects in your scene can speak. You must speak the specific lines for each actor when creating your program. The spell disguises your voice for each actor.

Heightened (8th) As the 6th-rank version, and the duration is unlimited.

spell->Prying Eye.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]
Ojo curioso
spell->Prying Eye.description: You create an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, floating eye, 1 inch in diameter, at a location you can see within 500 feet. It sees in all directions with your normal visual senses and continuously transmits what it sees to you. The first time you Sustain the Spell each round, you can either move the eye up to 30 feet, seeing only things in front of the eye, or move it up to 10 feet, seeing everything in all directions around it. There is no limit to how far from you the eye can move, but the spell ends immediately if you and the eye ever cease to be on the same plane of existence. You can attempt Seek actions through the eye if you want to attempt Perception checks with it. Any damage dealt to the eye destroys it and ends the spell.

spell->Summon Entity.name: Summon Entity
spell->Summon Entity.description:
You conjure an aberration to fight for you. This works like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4YnON9JHYqtLzccu]{Summon Animal}, except you summon a common creature that has the aberration trait and whose level is 5 or lower.

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15

spell->Summon Entity (Will-o'-Wisp Only).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i1TvBID5QLyXrUCa]
Invocar entidad (solo Will-o'-Wisp)
spell->Summon Entity (Will-o'-Wisp Only).description:
You conjure an aberration to fight for you. This works like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4YnON9JHYqtLzccu]{Summon Animal}, except you summon a common creature that has the aberration trait and whose level is 5 or lower.

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15

spell->Clairvoyance.name: Clairvoyance
spell->Clairvoyance.description: You create an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} floating eye at a location within range (even if it's outside your line of sight or line of effect). The eye can't move, but you can see in all directions from that point as if using your normal visual senses.

spell->Nightmare.name: Nightmare
spell->Nightmare.description:
You send disturbing nightmares to your target. The next time the target falls asleep, it must attempt a Will save. If you know the target only by name and have never met them, the target gets a +4 circumstance bonus to the Will save.

Critical Success The target suffers no adverse effects and is temporarily immune for 1 week.

Success The target experiences the nightmares but suffers no adverse effects other than unpleasant memories.

Failure The target experiences the nightmares and awakens @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Critical Failure The target experiences the nightmares, awakens Fatigued, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} until it is no longer Fatigued.

spell->Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
spell->Phantasmal Killer.description:
You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the target. Only the spell's target can see the killer, though you can see the vague shape of the illusion as it races forth to attack. The effect of the killer is based on the outcome of the target's Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes 4d6 mental damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target takes 8d6 mental damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is so afraid it might die. It must attempt a Fortitude save; if the target fails, it dies. On a successful Fortitude save, the target takes 12d6 mental damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} until the end of its next turn, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}. This effect has the incapacitation trait.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6 on a failure and by 3d6 on a critical failure.

spell->Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
spell->Phantasmal Killer.description:
You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the target. Only the spell's target can see the killer, though you can see the vague shape of the illusion as it races forth to attack. The effect of the killer is based on the outcome of the target's Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.
